Value for money - very good.

title: Good reasonable choice for NY hotel in thirties
text:
Helpful small friendly staff.  Kitchens. Large room. Clean. Gym and laundry machines did not use.
Linens and pillows could use upgrades.  Better rate when reserving directly.  My second visit.  First via booking service.

title: A tale of two rooms
text:
The above rating is an 'average' of the two different rooms we stayed in (we had to move) - the first was poor, the second, was good.  To me this sheds significant light upon the range of reviews for this hotel, but of concern is the fact that despite resolving the issue to some satisfaction, the cause of the issue in the first place leaves me suspicious of fairly underhand behaviour by this establishment.

We booked with hotels.com (which I've only ever used a couple of times before) and paid over a year in advance.  We were staying for 6 nights and wanted space / comfort so opted for the one bedroom option promising a king bed or two queens + a sofa bed and well furnished kitchen etc.  On arrival we were later than expected, tired, hungry and had tickets for the empire state, so we left our bags and went straight out.  Initial impressions of the room were somewhat disappointing, but on returning late that evening this feeling grew.  We checked our booking documentation and were dismayed to find that several of the features were not as promised - one queen bed (not two or a king, kitchen had no microwave or dishwasher etc).  So we raised this with the front desk who, after a brief chat with "the management" told us there had been a mistake, that they'd move us the next day (no rooms available sooner) and refund us $40 per night for having stayed in an inferior room.  There was no apology, no sign of surprise or concern - all very matter of fact leaving me with the distinct impression that they tried it on, on the basis that there were only 3 of us in a room that sleeps 4-6 and we hopefully wouldn't notice that we hadn't been given the room we'd booked.  The difference between the two rooms was huge -not just in terms of size and amenities, the second was far cleaner, better carpet, furniture etc.

All in all lovely doormen (as mentioned widely elsewhere) and at least one very nice room.  But also at least one room is not at all pleasant, there are questions over their approach and we found all of the front desk staff to be, at best, robotic and cold and at worst rude and disdainful. Key tip - be aware of the variety in room quality, check you've got what you were promised. 
Key advantage = size of rooms and location.  Perfect place to stay as a tourist - close to Grand Central, lots of good places to eat on the same block as the hotel, business centre two doors away etc.

NB We were on second and fourth floor at the front, noise was not a problem either time.
NB 2 A/c is ancient - would hate to stay in here in very hot weather.

title: Bell'hotel, in una posizione privilegiata.
text:
Questo hotel, si trova in una posizione ottimale per la visita di Manhattan, in quanto è sotiato in una strada molto verde e tranquilla, ma a due passi dalla Grand Central. L'hotel dispone di suites con camere molto belle e grandi, dotate di cucina indipendente, molto ben arredate e pulite, anche molto tranquille , specialmente quelle sul che danno sul retro. Io devo dire che non mi sono trovata benissimo, in  quanto mi hanno cambiato di camera durante il soggiorno, adducendo come scusa che avevo prenotato un letto King size e che in vece mi avevano assegnalo all'arrivo una due letti singoli; insomma, per farla breve, mi hanno tolto da una bella suite a due letti al quinto piano, silenziosissima, e mi hanno passato in una suite all'attico, molto più grande e con una bella terrazza, la quale però aveva numerossissimi difetti: era vicino all'atrio ascensori, e, ogni volta che l'ascensore partiva, faceva molto rumore, il mobilio era più moderno ma di qualità molto inferiore e mom in perfette condizioni, il letto era indubbiamente più scomodo con materasso mediocre, e la terrazza aveva una porta di vetro priva di tenda che non si poteva oscurare. 
Comunque, nonostante questi inconvenienti che ci hanno fatti arrabbiare, direi che l'hotel è da consigliare, e penso che se tornerò a NYC ci ritornerò

title: Hotel Antigo mas muito bem localizado!
text:
O Murray Hill é um hotel que está bem localizado e esse foi o maior atrativo para optarmos por ele. Fica entre a Lexington e a 3ª Ave, próximo à Grand Central Station que fica na 42. 
Logo na primeira esquina da Lexington com a 39th, você tem: de um lado, um mini mercado (que não é tão barato mas ajuda) e atravessando a rua,  um pequeno restaurante especializado em Lasanha. A comida é BB. Boa e barata e a frequência é bem legal, familiar. Na própria Lexington você tem ainda Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts e outras opções. É agradável ir caminhando por ela até a Estação Central.
Para quem gosta, tem vários bares de Taco e casas noturnas na 39, bem próximos ao hotel mas que não incomodam nada. A partir das 22 h fica cheio de jovens circulando por lá. 
Além do local, o hotel oferecia a opção de quarto Estúdio, com uma mini cozinha, geladeira, etc. Achei o quarto com mobiliário muito antigo e a cozinha estava feia, aspecto antigo, geladeira que não parecia fechar direito. Os talheres e materiais disponíveis também ficam em gavetas que pareciam que iam quebrar. Isso não gostei. O espaço era interessante pois são 45 m2 e como ficávamos pouco então relevei. A internet é paga e cara, então, a partir das 18 horas muitos hóspedes desciam para o lobby onde a internet era grátis. A limpeza era razoável. O preço ficou razoável por ter ido em período de alta temporada. Os atendentes foram prestativos e as bagagens podem ficar armazenadas. Check-in e check-out  eficientes.  Recomendo para quem vai com família e não faz questão de um hotel moderno!

title: Fuimos en familia y nos sentimos en casa
text: Camas amplias, cocina con todo lo necesario, linda decoración, cerca de  central station y de las lineas de bus, de restaurantes y mercadillos, salíamos a dar una vuelta por Brooklyn caminando todas las noches y cocinabamos en la cocina cuando las chicas caían cansadas por la noche. Atención muy correcta y limpieza total

title: Good Value apartment
text: If you want a large apartment rather than a hotel in a good location at a reasonable price this is a place you should consider. The staff were excellent and could not do enough for me. The rooms were very large and comfortable although they are looking dated. That being said the bed was excellent which is always an important factor.

title: Great budget hotel
text:
This hotel is located on a nice quiet side street.  It is a 10 minute walk to Grand Central Station and within a block walking distance there is a small market, diners, corner deli, small places to eat.  We had a one bedroom suite with kitchen which allowed us to eat in AND have our two teenagers in a separate room.  It also had a laundry room.  This was one of the largest AND economical places we looked at for our stay. 
The room furnishings are dated and the mattress on the sofa bed a bit lumpy but having a separate room for the kids to hang out in was worth it.

title: Clean and centrally located hotel
text:
A friend of mine and I spent a couple of nights here during our first trip to the US. I had read good things about the hotel online, which was one of the reasons I booked a room here. We were not disappointed! The price was ok and the location is great. It's only a couple of minutes away from Grand Central Terminal and if you are fit, you can walk to several other destinations in NY. If you don't feel like walking, you can get pretty much anywhere using the subway station at the GCT.

When we arrived, we got a room with a large queensize bed, which was not ideal. However, we got upgraded to a room with separate beds the day after we requested it. The staff was very friendly whenever we had any questions. The rooms are big, by the way. 

The only minor disturbances were the noise from the street (if you get a room facing the street...) and the fact that they charge you for Wifi use in your room. If you want to use the free Wifi, you have to sit in the lobby.

title: best place to stay
text: home away from home everything you could need perfect for families, groups, couples no frills clean, safe, central to everything, great location, looking forward to going back! in fact trying to get rooms for Feb 2014!

title: Great location, all suites
text: This hotel was in a great location of the Murray Hill area of mid-town Manhattan.  It is close to Grand Central Station and within walking distance to the Empire State Building.  Nice, spacious suites along with a kitchenette. Our suite had a double bed and a queen sleeper sofa.   Even though it is located in NYC, it was quiet at night.  The beds and linens were very comfortable and we had a super experience here.  There were 2 tvs and that was a nice plus as well. There is a grocery store on the next block as well as a Walgreens about 2 blocks away.  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Vale a pena
text: A localização é excelente, no coração de Manhattan. Está perto da Grand Central Station, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Central Park. Ótimo para quem ainda não conhece a cidade e melhor ainda para que já conhece. Ótimo atendimento. Suites muito boas, mas a cozinha muito antiga, poderia sofrer uma melhoria nos quartos, mas vale a pena.

title: ξενοδοχείο που αξίζει τα χρήματα που πληρώνεις
text: Πολύ καλό ξενοδοχείο που αξίζει τα χρήματα που πληρώνεις. Σχετικά κοντά στο κέντρο της ΝΥ χωρίς ιδιαίτερα καλή θέα αλλά άνετο, καθαρό και με πολύ ευγεγικό και εξυπηρετικό προσωπικό. Τα δωμάτιά του είναι ευρύχωρα, διαθέτει πλήρως εξοπλισμένη κουζίνα για μαγείρεμα, πολύ μεγάλο σαλόνι, με τηλεόραση στο κάθε δωμάτιο. Είναι διακοσμημένο με εξαιρετικό γούστο (αμερικάνικου στυλ καθαρά) με μόνο μειονέκτημα (?) τον χώρο της υποδοχής που είναι μάλλον μικρός για το μέγεθος του ξενοδοχείου.

title: Top
text: Locatie is super. Vlakbij centraal station. Met de metro ben je zo overal in de city. Ook met de auto goed te bereiken. We werden geholpen met parkeergarage. Incl korting bij parkeren. Zeer behulpzame portier getroffen! Kamers zijn groter dan verwacht. Echt voor herhaling vatbaar.

title: Mutio aconchegante
text: Ótima localização, perto da 5th av., Times Square e principais ruas do centro de Nova York. O quarto era bem amplo, possuia uma pequena cozinha e uma salinha com sofá. O atendimento do hotel foi ótimo.

title: Ideal
text:
Hotel trés bien situé à proximité de la gare de Grand central.
La chambre occupée 4 nuits était tres spacieuse avec 2 grands lits.
Il y a une petite cuisine que l'on aurait pu utiliser mais le frigo et la cafetiere nous ont suffi.
notre chambre sur l'arriére de l'immeuble était tres calme et avait meme une vue sur une petite place avec quelques arbres.
Les receptionnistes sont trés serviables.
Donc un trés bon séjour

title: Excelente apart hotel en Manhattan
text:
La verdad que nuestra estadía en este apart fue inmejorable, como sentirse en casa. Con una cocina sencilla pero útil, buena limpieza diaria, excelentes colchones, un buen baño hecho a nuevo, buena presión de agua para una ducha reconfortante luego de un día intenso.
El personal amable en general, hay varias personas que hablan en español.
Cerca de todo (3 cuadras de Central Station), pero lejos de lo ruidoso de la Gran Manzana.
Realmente lo recomiendo, nosotros viajamos con mi marido e hija mayor, y nos sentimos muy cómodos.

title: Run-down but cozy and clean
text: I stayed here for about 3 nights, and I did enjoy it, but the rooms seemed rather old and run-down. However, it was still a nice place, and the kitchenette was pretty handy to have. It was not at all posh or extravagant but it was a good deal and comfortable.

title: Great Place to Stay
text:
Very handy to most mid Manhattan places & subway system. Hotel was presented well (although a little dated) but very comfortable. Only had one (out of 2) elevator working when we were there which was a bit annoying having to wait.Room was fine , having a kitchenette was also handy.
Recommend you get a room not facing the street due to noise from below.

title: Excelente opcion en Manhattan
text: Recien llegado de NYC les comento que estuvimos en el Murray , y es una opcion de primera , no solo por la ubicacion sino tambien por el precio ya que es un Apart y por ende esta la posibilidad de almorzar o cenar en la habitacion , lo que no deja de ser importante  a la hora de no excederse con los gastos . Las habitaciones son grandes en relacion a cualquier hotel de ese precio ya que tienen un living gigante con LCD y una habitacion tanbien bastabte comoda , muchos placares  , caja de seguridad propia y buen A.A. , el lobby es un poco chico ya que se junta mucha gente para el wifi gratuito ( otra tonteria de los americanos , el no poner o cobrar el wifi en la habitacion ) , pero al margen de esto es una excelente opcion .

title: Ottima soluzione
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per sette notti rimanendo molto soddisfatti. Lo staff del'hotel è molto gentile e pronto a dare consigli e aiuto. La stanza era molto ampia e confortevole, con cucinino, angolo pranzo con ampio tavolo, angolo salotto con poltrona a 3 posti e poltrona singola, TV schermo piatto, letto matrimoniale confortevole. E' situato in una zona tranquilla a pochi minuti a piedi dalla Grand Central e da supermercati aperti 24h. Il wi-fi funziona gratuitamente nella hall, inoltre in una stanza al piano terra sono state attrezzate delle postazioni con PC e stampante a disposizione degli ospiti gratuitamente. Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo. I mobili e la moquette nella stanza sono un pò datati ma non è molto rilevante. Nella stanza manca il forno a micronde (strano ma non ho neanche chiesto le ragioni)

title: Like coming home!
text: I went back to Murray Hill East after 3 years. It was like coming home - to spacious comfort but noting that a renovation is sorely needed! I have stayed there various times on trips to the United Nations NYC as I travel too frequently to stay in pokey NYC hotel rooms. The spaciousness, comfort and basic amenities were all there. I booked a studio room as I had family visiting for a couple of nights and friends on the weekend- all of which meant i needed more than a hotel room. I paid 248 USD per night plus 8.95 per night for wireless. I will definitely stay there again as teh location is superb! far away from the regular tourist madness of 42nd street - but a straight bus up to teh Upper East side for meetings, 2 blocks away from Grand central station and close to several excellent restaurants including the Oyster bar at Grand central and the Nam Pang Vietnamese Sandwich shop on 41st street. For shoppers - several good stores nearby plus beauty salons and Duane Reade which i used extensively all within 2 blocks. The Pod hotel next door has an excellent rooftop bar and great lounge restaurant for tapas and drinks. The rooms show real signs of wear though and have not been renovated in over a decade. I stayed in 609 which has tow single beds and both mattresses were worn from use and I had a bit of a back ache after a couple of nights. The linen, utensils, etc all could do with replacement. I had to tussle to get the gas on every morning to heat water for my tea. Housekeeping run by two Polish women is efficient and good. All in all i would go back again for space and convenience but not expecting luxury surroundings.

title: Great Location and Clean
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed from 6/3 to 6/7 2013. We had a one bedroom suite and had plenty of room to spread out and relax after a long day on the town. It was nice to have the small kitchen to fix a few snacks and the refrigerator for our leftovers and beverages. The staff was very accommodating and knowledgeable about the area. The housekeeping staff was more than willing to deal with us sleeping late some mornings and still managed to clean and stock our room. The location was great, just a short walk to grand central. There was plenty of lighting in the area to feel safe on our walks back after dark. Great price for the location.

title: Viel Platz, alles sauber, super Lage
text: Wir waren eine Woche im Murray Hill East Side Suites mit einem Kind (5 J.). Wir hatten sehr viel Platz. Seperates Schlafzimmer, voll ausgestattete Küche, Essbereich, Wohnzimmer. Es gab Waschmaschinen und Trockner und einen Fitnessraum. 5 Minuten entfernt ist die Grand Central Station. Alle Mitarbeiter waren sehr nett. Alles war sehr sauber. Wir waren wirklich zufrieden und würden gerne wieder kommen.

title: Murray Hill East Sweet
text:
Selected this hotel as we always go for suites. Our usual hotel (The EastGate Tower) had closed down and was under renovation as luxury Condos.

The MHES was a block up from the Eastgate Tower and we had passed it many times on previous visits.

Check in was quick and easy and the room (1107) was already prepared.
 As with the Eastgate Tower, if you are looking for plush decor and furniture, this place is not for you.

But like me, if you was a fan of the Eastgate Tower for it'slocation, cost and simplicity, then MHES is like home from home.

There were a few niggly things but I won't detract from the experience by mentioning them as if you look under enough stones, you will definitely find a worm.

My two adult children occupied the two beds in the bedroom while my wife and I ended up with the pull out sofa bed.

The mattress was really thin and was so uncomfortable that I prefered to sleep in an armchair with my feet up on a chair.

The only thing that annoyed me was the cost of the wireless in the bedroom, $7.99 a day and $60 a month, nothing in between.
As we were staying 7 days, the month tariff was a no brainer.

Wireless was free in the Lobby but charging for wireless anywhere is a sure way to lose potential clients.

On the day of leaving, we secured a late check out for 3pm but as it was raining really heavily and we had done most things already, we extended this to 7pm for a price.

Really great place in a great location in a great City.

PS
If you ask the hotel to arrange a taxi, town car or Limo to (or from) JKF, ensure that you confirm the cost including tolls before you get onboard. 

Our driver tried to rip us off on the return to JFK, fortunately we had checked on what we would expect to pay at the hotel.

NYC taxis are a flat $52 + tolls and optional tip to  and from JFK. You can ask for a route avoiding the toll and the drivers are happy to do this (at particular times) if you hint that it will be more tip for them.

Town cars are typically $65 including tolls.

title: 広い～!!
text: NYC１０回目の滞在で初めてお気に入りのホテル出会いました。パリからロンドン経由でJFK到着が夜遅くホテルにチエックインしたのが深夜をまわってました。部屋が空いていたのか１２階のテラス付きジュニアスィートを利用できました。チェックイン時に＄４８を取られましたがチェックアウトの時に返金してくれました。１２階テラスからの展望はイーストリバーも見えて最高です。地下にあるコインランドリーは洗濯機乾燥機との＄２で利用可能。キッチン付きなので２nd Ave にあるグロサリーで食料品を買って簡単な料理ができました。クロゼットも二つあり、とにかくニューヨークのホテルにしては広いのでゆっくりのんびり過ごすことができます。ロビーでFreeのWifiが利用できます、そのためかロビーはいつも混雑気味でした。スタックはフレンドリーだったしロケーションも申し分ない、狭くて古いニューヨークのホテルイメージが払拭され快適に過ごせたので、次回もこのホテルを利用したいと思いました。

title: Amplitud privada, estrechez compartida
text:
Excelente ubicación en el centro de Manhattan. Amplísimas y bien equipadas suites. Buen servicio, capaz de expresarse en español.
 En la parte negativa habría que mencionar la estrechez del lobby,  que apenas permite encontrar un asiento para chatear, la interminable espera ante el único ascensor que estaba en servicio y el ruido procedente de la calle 39, en cuesta, que nos recordaba que New York nunca duerme

title: Apart còmodo y bien ubicado
text:
Hola,me alojè en este hotel en mayo, en la primera habitaciòn que nos dieron no funcionaba la heladera por lo que nos cambiaron  a una muy ruidosa en el primer piso frente a la calle.Recien al dìa siguiente nos pasaron a una  mejor .màs grande y en piso alto,El apart es antiguo y los muebles necesitan renovaciòn,el sofà cama estaba destartalado y las camas de la habitaciòn eran correctas.
La estadìa estuvo bien. La cocina era completa,tenìa microondas y lavavajillas.La ubicaciòn es buena,muy cerca a la Grand Central.

title: Good location but suites are tired
text:
This was my second stay at Murray Hill East Suites and I was rather disappointed this time.  I booked a studio and although I was told I had been upgraded, it was hard to see how the room I was given was an improvement on the basic studio.  The decor was tired and the carpet was stained, giving an overall impression of lack of cleanliness.  The amount of space is great, especially for NYC, and the room was quiet.  However the airconditioning was noisy and there did not appear to be a way to vary the temperature (which was pretty warm).  The kitchenette was barely adequate with no sign of the advertised microwave and dishwasher.  Just a sink, a stove, an oven that set off the smoke alarm when turned on, a coffee machine and a few odds and sods of crockery and cutlery. 1 large saucepan and 1 small frying pan.  Not enough to cook with, or even to heat food up.
The suites are still good value for NYC, the staff are good and there is free wifi in the lobby.  I would stay there again, but I would recommend booking a 1-bedroom apartment if having any sort of functional kitchen is important to you.

title: nice hotel with kitchen
text:
This is a very nice little hotel in midtown area, surrounded  of bars and restaurants and a walk close to Grand station and The Empire state building. In a good neighborhood, I was able to walk late in the streets no problem,  you have markets and pharmacy very close also. 
The staff very nice, I have a double room, super spacious with kitchen (refrigerator, stove, plates, cups, and coffee maker), living room area, and a little round table.  Good size bathroom.  Clean and comfortable. There is Wi-Fi access in the lobby. The price, not cheap, 583.98$ for 2 nights, but is the price you pay for the area

title: NEL COMPLESSO BUONO
text: abbiamo soggiornato per 7 gg in questa struttura e ci siamo trovati molto bene. abbiamo approfittato di una offerta su booking ed abbiamo preso una suite ad un prezzo molto vantaggioso. la posizione è buona stanze pulite e molto ampie...il problema era solo la moquette..ma si trova spesso in quest strutture...

title: Muy bueno
text: Nos alojamos en febrero, la ubicación es buena muy cerca de macys y times square, en la esquina hay un minisuper para comprar comida y llevar a la habitacion, la calefaccion muy buena, amplia habitacion, internet en el lobby gratis, volveria!

title: Good place good value
text: Good value for money. We stayed for 5 nights and the little kitchen helped a lot. There is a market close by to buy food and groceries and nice pizza just around the corner. It is nothing fancy but just what we needed. Good location - 3 blocks from grand central station.

title: Very good, excellent trade off quality/price
text:
For my second time in NY I choose the Murray, the suite 1107, for a 7 night stay, with plenty of room. Although facing directly the 39th,it was quite in the night, the noises from the street coming up around 7 am, ...but anyway, that's the time to get up and rush out! Kitchen well equipped. Bathroom tiny but with everything. Cleaning every day. Furniture a bit old style but never mind, since the position of this hotel is excellent to walk and visit everything and the trade off price/quality is excellent by NY standards. I tried the gym, located in the basement, facing a small garden. Staff at the reception very helpful, they satisfied efficiently all our requests, door men friendly. 
I recommend it!

title: Lindo hotel a buen precio!
text:
Me alojé en este hotel a fines de Marzo pasado con mi hija adolescente. La habitación es comodísima! Muy amplia, con un living confortable, una mesa para comer, una kitchenette con lo necesario (no tenía microondas pero se podía solicitar a conserjería) El baño impecable, buena agua caliente, limpio, con mueble bajo mesada para guardar cosas. Amplios placards, buena luz, buenas cortinas blackout. 
No tiene los servicios de room service y restaurante, pero no hace falta, ya que a una cuadra hay un market donde comprar de todo y a cualquier hora! La ubicación es excelente, a 3 cuadras de la Grand Central Station desde donde se puede ir a cualquier parte de la ciudad y alrededores! Yo acostumbraba a alquilar departamentos en mis viajes previos a NY pero este hotel tiene el confort y amplitud de un departamento sumado a la seguridad y servicios de un hotel. Muy recomendable para presupuestos módicos!

title: bueno muy comodo
text: resulto biueno y comodo sobretopdo por tener cocina completa que nos permitio poder comer tranquilos alli,el precio no es malo compartsandolo con similares pero.......podria tener personal mas amable y ser mas limpio lo mejor la amplitud y el estar en el middletown cerca de estacion central todo el transporte para movernos

title: Géniale
text: Hôtel propre et calme, chambre spacieuse et confortable, personnel professionnel et sympathique. Il est super bien situé à proximité de grand central station avec les métros, les bus les trains et les navettes des aéroports. Proximité des sites touristiques : Chrysler Building, Empire State et une liaison directe à Times square et Broadway. Même un ferry pour rejoindre Brooklyn bridge ;-)

title: Quiet - Clean - Quaint
text: I really liked this little place. It's located an historic section of NYC. I only stayed one night and my room was on the ground floor so I can't speak for the views.  The Murray Hill East Hotel is an excellent choice the room was and efficiency so you could stay for the week and make it your own. It stands close to numerous attractions, including the Empire State Building, Times Square, Lincoln Center, Madison Square Garden, the theaters on Broadway and Fifth Avenue shopping and you are within walking distance to the United Nations as well.

title: per noi la formula perfetta !
text:
Siamo tornati da pochi giorni e già ci manca la nostra casina di new york !
Posizione strategica per visitare qualsiasi punto della città anche perchè molto vicina alla grand central terminal da cui partono tutte le metro possibili e immaginabili.
Avevamo una suite al 10° piano con grande living room, cucinotto e ampia camera con due letti francesi. 
Personale sempre molto cortese e disponibile, ci hanno sistemato la lavastoviglie anche di domenica ! Pulizie accurate e cambio asciugamani tutti i giorni.
Unico neo un solo ascensore con problemi di ingolfamento soprattutto la mattina.
Spero di ritornarci !

title: Great place
text: Plenty of room, good location, nice staff.  Décor is a little dated but everything is in good shape and very clean.  Great deal for the very reasonable prices.  good place to stay if you're looking for decent place for fair money.

title: Una casa lontano da casa
text: Abbiamo alloggiato in 3 adulti in un appartamento comprensivo di:camera matrimoniale con letto king size, soggiorno con tavolo per il pranzo ed annessa zona notte con divano letto matrimoniale ,bagno con vasca/doccia, cucina.Appartamento ideale per chi ricerca funzionalità e buon rapporto qualitá-prezzo, con la comoditá del servizio alberghiero per la pulizia quotidiana.Non per chi cerca la sistemazione moderna di design.Cucina accessoriata con lavastoviglie, frigo piuttosto grande, micronde, bollittore, tostapane, stoviglie varie.Presenti due tv, una cassaforte, moltissimi cassetti ed armadi, asse e ferro da stiro.Pulizia sufficiente.Viene pulita anche la cucina e lavate le stoviglie utilizzate.Rispetto ai prezzi di Ny, ritengo abbia un buon rapporto qualitá-prezzo, considerando la dimensione media delle stanze di nyc.Noi eravamo al sesto piano e non eravamo per nulla disturbati dal rumore esterno.A 10 minuti a piedi dalla Grand Central quindi comodissimo per i vari collegamenti metro, ma anche per muoversi a piedi.

title: Great value.
text: When we arrived the staff were all very helpful.  The room was very large, but dated... no big deal though.  The rooms were clean and the location was excellent.  It was nice having a full kitchen since there is no dining at the hotel itself.  Overall, I enjoyed the stay and would recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

title: Good value for money
text: This hotel gives great value for money. We stayed in a studio suite which was much more spacious and better equipped than a standard hotel room would have been. Decor is possibly a little dated, but we don't find this an issue, Maid service was great, reception staff were helpful, and the position of the hotel is brilliant for sightseeing.

title: Gran ubicación, comodidad
text:
Me alojé en el MHES en Marzo 2013. ubicación es ideal, cerca de todo, pero no en el medio de todo. En una zona tranquila y segura- Me alojé junto a mi familia, esposo, 2 hijas adolescentes y 1 niña. La suite de 2 habitaciones en la que estuvimos era muy amplia, cómoda y confortable. La cocina permite abastecerse y eventualmente cocinar allí si lo desea.
Fueron muy amables ante nuestras preguntas.
La limpieza, diaria y cambio de sábanas y toallas también diario.
Se nota que tiene algunos años, pero está bien mantenido y por esa razón sus ambientes son tan amplios.

title: buen hotel, calido y fliar
text:
la ubicación cerca de todo pero no en el medio del ruido. a tres cuadras de la gran estación central. departamentos grandes, buenos colchones y sabanas y toallas. las cambian todos los días y te limpian el dto. 
lavadero en subsuelo. genial si vas con flia. 
excelente atención. nos fuimos a Boston 4 días y nos guardaron las valijas.
wifi solo en lobby . en el dto es de pago.
la única contra que estaban renovando los ascensores y funcionaba solo uno.
el resto todo genial.para volver. ideal para flias.alejandra ( argentina)

title: Nice room, Good service
text:
We reserved through a travel site and got a pretty good price (for a midtown hotel!). The room was very large, with a nice sitting area with a pull out couch and a small kitchen (not that we used it, but nice to know we had the option!).
The hotel is just a few easy blocks from Grand Central Station. The location was the best part. Easy walking distance to lots of attractions and the subway. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. One of the elevators was being upgraded while we were there, so there was only one working and that made for long waits. We found it quicker to use the stairs but the stairwells were pretty grungy and a little scary.
Just a warning, we found the beds to be very uncomfortable. They seemed good enough at first, but I continuously woke during the night with some body part lacking circulation and every morning we were stiff and sore. Also, the coffee provided in the room is disgusting. If you will be making coffee in the room, I actually suggest bringing your own!

title: Excellent hotel
text: We found this hotel online after we had checked in to another hotel which was really disappointing. The Murray Hill was a pleasure to visit. The rooms were lovely and were very spacious. Every member of staff was friendly and helpful, from the receptionist who couldn't have been more helpful, to the doormen, who were always welcoming. The location is good and area is nice. I would recommend walking down to 3rd Avenue. We discovered it on our last day and it looked nice. I would definitely return.

title: Gute Lage, grosse Zimmer
text: Gut gelegenes Hotel nahe der Central Station und in Fussdistanz zum Times Square. Grosse Zimmer mit angenehmem Bett, Bad, Polstergruppe, (Ess-)Tisch, Küche mit genügend Geschirr, aber ohne Küchentücher, Flachbild-TV, kurz: fast alles was man braucht. Unser Zimmer zum "Hinterhof" war ruhig, d.h. mit dem für Manhattan üblichen Geräusch-Grundpegel. Das Personal war hilfsbereit und nett. Wir würden wieder dort buchen.

title: Haven of comfort
text: Arrived at Penn Station, got lost and found, and then reached the healing comfort of Murray Hill.  Welcoming and efficient staff, a comfortable spacious set of rooms and peace.  Close to the Chrysler building and many small excellent eateries this was the perfect base for my first visit to NYC.  My only gripe is that free wifi is only available in the lobby but that is a very small moan.  The rooms were very clean and well maintained - everything worked and as in all of NY I felt welcome and valued and safe.  The staff care that your stay is a pleasant experience.  Looking forward to my next visit.

title: Lo necesario para disfrutar Nueva York
text: Contar con un departamento con cocina es una muy buena opción, nos quedamos unas 12 noches, somos una familia con 2 hijas adolescentes. Las instalaciones, la decoración,  y los elementos de cocina se nota que tienen algunos años pero están en buen estado. La atención del personal es cordial y eficiente, la ubicación muy buena.  La limpieza es muy buena. Que cosas podrían mejorarse?, hay wifi sin cargo solo en la recepción (en las habitaciones se puede pagar para tener este servicio), las frazadas están un poco deterioradas. Nuestra conclusión es que volveríamos en nuestra próxima vista !

title: Good stay for business
text: This hotel is a good deal if you regularly get to UN buildings etc as it is only 10mins walking distance. The hotel is clean and staff are very friendly, and housekeeping is very efficient. Was impressed with their service. Although I did experience quite a lot of static shocks during my stay due to cold but nothing harmful.

title: The best deal for the price, in every way
text: Unlike a lot of mid-budget hotels in New York, The Murray Hill is everything it claims to be. Simple, clean and functional apartments, excellent housekeeping and friendly staff who accommodate requests for early check-ins and late check-outs with quiet efficiency, even when the lobby is seething with hassled guests. The location is perfect - in the heart of Manhattan and just two blocks away from the UN, surrounded by shopping and great places to eat. There is no restaurant, so no in-house breakfast - but Le Pain Quotidien with its magical fressh-baked bread and luscious Belgian chocolate is just a few short blocks away. Taxis are easily available just outside the door and Grand Central Station is just around the corner. The apartment is welcoming and comfortable. I particuarly appreciated the fact that the bed (again unlike beds in most New York hotels) was not soggy and squishy. Good coffee on the house in generous amounts was a pleasant bonus. Just one suggestion - extend the free wifi to the rooms. It's a pain to pay for it by the day.

title: Better and better every year
text:
We came back to this hotel especially because of its staff and the size of the rooms at a decent price. We haven't been disappointed. The staff is as friendly and helpful as ever and the hotel is improving: New elevators are being installed, the old ones really needed replacement.
Many thanks to all the staff who make their customers feel at home during their stay.

title: Amplo e bem localizado
text:
Dependendo da tarifa, pode ser um bom custo benefício. 

Prós: Suite ampla, muito além da média em NY. Cama king muito boa. Serviço do hotel muito bom, aceita check-in tardios.
 

Contras:Cozinha precisa de reformas, não consegui usar pois era repulsiva. Não espere muito neste quesito. 

Conclusão: se a tarifa for boa, vale a pena!

title: Great value and so close to everything
text: These are older style, no frills apartments. But they are great value for money and so close to everything in NewYork. We had a one bedroom apartment which had a massive bedroom with a king size bed and heaps of storage space. The lounge room had a sofa bed, dinning space, two lounge chairs and a television. There was also a kitchenette, supplied with ample kitchenware and a bathroom. We travelled as a family of four, with two teenage daughters and the apartments was spacious enough. The teenagers shared the sofa bed. The apartments was serviced daily. There is free WiFi, but only in the lobby so if you wanted to use it you had to sit in the lobby or you can pay for it in your room. The building also has an exercise room and great laundry facilities. The apartments are in an awesome location - three easy walking blocks to Grand Central Station, a walk to Times Square, Empire State Building, Bryant Park. There are plenty of grocery stores and restaurants located in the area as well. We stayed here over Christmas 2012. The staff were friendly and efficient. These apartments are priced very well considering their location. I would stay here again next time I'm in New York.

title: Couldnt ask for more
text: The hotel is clean, spacious rooms and a great value for the money.  The staff was friendly, helpful and very efficient.  I brought my 8-year-old granddaughter with me and we didnt feel cramped for space at all.

title: Pretty good if the price is right
text:
This is a converted apartment building, probably dating from the '50s.  Our room was clearly once a studio apartment, so it has a kitchen and is decently roomy.  The TV is all digital, which is almost unique for NYC.  It has internet, although I didn't use it.  It also has an exercise room, which is not great, but good enough.  The room was adequately lighted, including a light on the small desk.  Often more upscale hotels lack adequate lighting.

As always when I stay in NYC hotels, i checked quite carefully for insects.  There were none that I could spot.

There were a fair number of plugs in the main room, but all of them were used for the lights and TV.  If you want to charge the batteries on your phones and IPADs, you should bring a 3 for 1 plug with you.

There are only two elevators, and one is shut for renovation, leaving only one.  That one is in need of maintenance, with many floor indicator lights not functioning.  It is used by the housekeeping staff, and I was expecting long wait times, although we never did have to wait too long.  The halls are narrow and somewhat dingy.  The lobby is plain.  The staff was minimally courteous..  

It used old-fashion metal keys.  

It's on 39th, near 3rd, meaning a 10 minute walk to Grand Central Station.

I'd go again, if he price is right.

title: Good Value for the Price
text:
I recommend the Murray Hill Suites as a clean, friendly hotel with no frills. The location is very convenient--3 blocks from Grand Central Station-walking distance to 5th Ave and 34th street  shopping and the Empire State Building, with Times Square a little bit further away but walkable.  The staff-the front desk-Bellmen and maids were freindly and accomodating. Our room was on the 8th floor facing the back of the building which was quite at night.  Our room had a king bed, two tables with chairs-two night stands, a large dresser with a mirror, a loveseat/couch, a small kitchen and two ample sized closets.  The furnature and fixures were older but maintained and our room was clean.  We had a 40inch flat screen tv mounted on the wall that had good reception and plenty of cable TV channels.  The shower hot water was a bit inconsistent-the water started out hot-cooled off and then got hot again-but really not a big deal.  There was no micowave in our room as seen in some of the hotel pictures, but we did not need it anyways.  The coffee machine worked fine. There is no pool, no business center with a computer, or no restaurant in the hotel.  The elevator was slow and at times a bit of a wait. The gym was small but had enough equipment for a quick weight lifting and cadio workout.  There are pubs, delis, pizza parlors, small grocery stores, Starbucks, Duncan donuts, a Dagostinos grocery store (NYC Chain) and restaurants of various types within a 2 to 3 block radius of the hotel. There is a good bagel store on Lexington around the corner from the hotel.
Personally, I don't see the need to spend a lot on an expensive NYC hotel with all the bells and whistles, if you are out most of the day seeing and doing things in the City. We were mostly in our room at night to sleep and during the day for short rest stops-so we did not need extra amenities or frills. If you are like minded, then I would highly recommend this hotel that was reasonably priced, clean and comfortable--in a good location.

title: What I Wish I Knew On My First Trip to New York City
text:
As the time grew near for a business conference in NYC, I started looking into accommodations. Manhattan is expensive, regardless of where you stay.... well, not exactly.  From tons and tons of research I find the Murray Hill East Suites.  Two double beds, a small love seat for watching TV and (ready for this?) a kitchenette! All for the low price of $111 a night plus tax!  As a disclaimer I must add... This pricing may not be typical and your results may vary. I am not an actor nor do I play one on TV. See dealer for details, this offer void where prohibited. Kayak and Orbitz had virtually the same price when searching, we booked with Orbitz. Calling the hotel directly will get you a price match from any advertised site at a worse case scenario. 

...but I digress.  The Murray Hill East Suites is by no means the Ritz.  It is an older building with character, built back in the days when it was taboo to have a 13th floor.  As a side note, there is a 14th floor and a Penthouse.  It is a clean hotel, the staff is awesome with careful attention to detail and the location in Midtown was perfect for my needs. The fitness room had modern equipment and I found the area to be more than adequate.  The maid did an excellent job of cleaning our room and was very friendly.  The doorman always greeted you with a smile and was there to hold the door open up until at least midnight.  The staff was very knowledgeable about the surrounding area and guided me to the absolute BEST clam chowder I have ever eaten within an easy 2 minute walk. 

There are nicer places to stay especially if you have a larger budget that I was working with.  When in NYC, how much time do you spend in your room anyway? In my 4 night stay I might have spent 2 hours in the room when not sleeping.  For the price... can't be beat.  Will stay there anytime I head into Midtown.

title: Pas grand chose à redire...
text:
Hôtel extrêmement bien situé (5mn à pied de grand Central Station, Lexington, Madison et 5ème avenue très proches, central park à 20 minutes environ), l'accueil est très agréable et courtois, et les chambres, bien qu'un peu vieillottes, sont tout à fait fonctionnelles et propres. A noter cependant : Essayer de privilégier le côté cour car le côté rue est un peu bruyant.
Partis à 2, nous avons opté pour un studio avec grand lit, cuisine équipée et évidemment salle de bains. Largement suffisant et très spacieux, avec grand lit, le seul bémol serait sur la cuisine ou le mobilier est à peine juste. 
Un très bon rapport qualité prix (la cuisine évite les déjeuners/dîners dehors qui peuvent rapidement coûter cher si récurrents car il faut systématiquement donner ajouter le pourboire à la note initiale) pour un hôtel sans prétention mais largement suffisant pour ce qu'on lui demande! N'hésitez pas!

title: si quieres Glamour  ahi no es el Lugar
text:
La habitacion que me toco era como tipo estudio, tenia una cocina con lavadora de trastes , pero sin refigerador ???  es economico pero todo es viejo. Si viajas de bajo presupuesto esta bien, en mi caso lo compre atravez de price line pero me arrepentí, La Dominicana del mostrador era tan despota , No tienen servocio de WI -FI  y te tienes que salir al Lobby para tener conexión
A mi me toco la habitación frente al Lobby   Santo DIOS   parecía que me habia quedado en la recepción

title: Ideal para grupos y estadía prolongada
text: Departamento con servicio de hotel. Edificio viejo, decoración antigua. Unidades cómodas, mucho placard, cocina vieja pero en condiciones, lavadero en el edificio. Internet bastante precario. Así y todo, nos resulto muy cómodo para una semana de estadía . Llegábamos cansados y comprábamos comida en el camino. Se economiza bastante ya que cenar y en realidad comer en Newto York es caro. Además, en invierno uno regresa más temprano al hotel y ya no sale. Fuimos con dos hijos adolescentes y nos resulto muy cómodo. La ubicación es muy buena. Esta muy cerca de la grand central station y en la zona hay buen ambiente y muchos delis para comprar comida preparada. Nosotros después nos fuimos de viaje en auto y cuando volvimos nos alojamos en el hotel The Time y llegamos a la conclusión que estábamos mejor en este departamento. Sin dudas lo recomiendo y volvería.

title: Great location, nice people, clean rooms
text: The front desk personnel were pleasant. They answered my questions nicely. There is still only one elevator but I did not find that I had to wait long. I stayed on a Tuesday night so maybe it is busier on weekends. Room was dated but very clean. It is super easy for cabs to and from laguardia plus ten minute walk max to 5th avenue, library, bryant park, and grand central. For the price I do not expect modern luxury rooms and valets and concierges. Just nice, simple, clean place to stay with pleasant service. They delivered.

title: Viaje para las fiestas
text: Con mi familia fuimos para las fiestas y con el frío había muy buena calefacción. Con respecto al wifi los primeros días había gratis en las habitaciones y luego fue solo en el lobby, para un buen wifi en el lobby tenes que estar solo sino anda lento. Las habitaciones completas con camas cómodas. Tiene una gran ubicación ya que a muy pocas cuadras esta la gran estación central que es muy linda y su mercado es muy completo y de gran calidad.

title: Muy Recomendable
text: Es un apart, con habitaciones muy completas, algunas incluyen lavavajillas, tiene servicio de Internet sin cargo en el Loby, en las habitaciones se debe pagar 8 dolares por día. La ubicaciones es excelente, a tres cuadras de la Gran Central donde se puede ir a cualquier lado de Manhattan. La Atención en la admisnistración no fue del todo buena, hubo mala predisposición y ante un inconveniente que tuvimos, se pasaban el problema de uno a otro.

title: NOT UP TO SCRATCH
text: Location was great but during the end of our stay we had a mouse running around our room during the night and could not sleep at all.  They reluctantly moved us the next morning but i got the impression they thought we were over-reacting about the incident.  I'm not sure if he was the Hotel Manager or not but i did find him very un-friendly and when i checked out 2 days later he was still un-friendly.  I won't recommend this Hotel and wont' be staying here again.  This is my 2nd review about this Hotel so hopefully it will be submitted unlike the 1st one...

title: Muy buena ubicacion y amplio
text: Fuimos con mi mujer, realmente la pasamos super, Es una ciudad imperdible y por su buena ubicacion caminabamos para todos lados, ya que esta a 3 cuadras de la estacion central. Es amplio, pueden desayunar y cenar tranquilamente en dicho lugar. No es lujoso pero tratandose de una ciudad tan cara la relacion esta buena porque uno ahorra plata concinandose. El servicio de limpieza es muy bueno y son atentos. Recomiendo tambien quie tomen el bus turistico, ya que los lleva por poco dinero por toda la ciudad. Espero que les sirva.

title: ottima posizione
text:
La posizione è ottima, il quartiere tranquillo e la notte si dorme tranquilli. In 15 minuti si arriva a TImes Square e in nemmeno 10 si è alla Grand Central Station. La nostra camera, meglio definirla come mini appartamento era grande, confortevole e carina anche se l'arredamento andrebbe rinnovato e il riscaldamento potenziato. Il problema di questa struttura è lo staff. Le ragazze non credo siano in grado di sorridere, dato il fatto che in 10 giorni di permanenza abbiamo ricevuto sbuffi e informazioni come se fossero enormi favori. L'eccezione è il bellboy,  sempre gentile e sorridente! 
E' un peccato perchè la struttura è ottima sia per posizione che per comodità, forse un pò cara ma per quello che offre il rapporto qualità prezzo è ottimo. Basterebbe solo sistemare quei piccoli accorgimenti che fanno la differenza.Tutto sommato lo consiglio a chi cerca un appartamento con i servizi di un hotel.

title: posizione perfetta
text:
Abbiamo alloggiato presso questo hotel a dicembre 2012. Le stanze sono molto grandi e confortevoli, composte da una camera da letto, salotto, cucina e bagno.
Abbiamo utilizzato anche il servizio del deposito bagaglio per qualche giorno, ma vi raccomando, anche se dovete tornare a dormire nello stesso hotel bisogna farsi rilasciare la ricevuta dell'avvenuta consegna del bagaglio!
Il personale (tranne 1 operatore) è stato sempre molto gentile e disponibile anche se nessuno di loro parla italiano.
Fondamentale è la posizione dell'hotel rispetto alle attrazioni da visitare a Manhattan spostandosi a piedi o in metro.
La stazione centrale è a pochi passi dall'albergo.
E' possibile  prendere lo shuttle per gli spostamento da e per gli aeroporti sempre nei pressi della stazione.
In conclusione se dovessi tornare a New York ci ritornerei.

title: Don't be deceived by the other reviews like we were
text:
They had only 1 elevator working and the one that worked stopped on every floor no matter what floor button you pressed. The staff had friendly moments, but it seemed that you needed to speak Spanish in order to be treated the same way. We were quoted a price at the beginning of our stay by the hotel and that price changed at the time of checkout. The only reason we stayed at this hotel was for the bed set up of having 2 queen beds and a pull out bed, however I would have rather paid for an extra room at a nicer hotel than try to save.
The bathroom and kitchen only had a vent, no fan. The smell of the bathroom came into the room and was extremely unpleasant.

title: Très bien
text:
Hôtel bien situé, chambres spacieuses et fonctionnelles, avec coin cuisine, personnel sympathique et serviable.
Rien à redire, séjour d'une semaine très agréable en famille.
Quartier assez calme pour NY, insonorisation très acceptable.
5 minutes à pied de Grand Central Station.

title: Great location and value
text: These apartments are well situated, especially for anyone working at the UN (10 mins walk), but also for anyone visiting NY who likes the extra space and convenience of an apartment.  I was upgraded from a studio to a 1-bed apartment which was great for entertaining colleagues.  The apartment was very quiet, and comfortably furnished with adequate, though not elegant, appointments.  The kitchen was well-supplied, and perfectly suited to making breakfast or a light meal if you want a night in.  Everything was clean and working.  My only gripe is the charge for internet access in the apartment, although free wifi was available in the lobby.

title: ottima posizione
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato per 7 giorni in questo albergo. E' praticamente al centro, si possono raggiungere in pochi minuti a piedi tutti i siti di interesse. E' vicino alla stazione e soprattutto vicino agli autobus che portano all'aeroporto. 
Le stanze sono grandi e confortevoli.

title: nell'ombelico del mondo!
text: dovendo trovarci con ns. figlia che si è traferita per studio e lavoro in usa abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel.posizione ottimale rispetto a tutto quello che c'e' da vedere a ny.si può tranquillamente partire a piedi alla scoperta dell'empire state ddi times square ed è pieno di ristorantini in zona e anche di superamarket

title: bon hotel pour passer une semaine a new york
text:
bien situé
personnel sympatique
suite spacieuse 
centre de fitness trop petit
internet payant dans les chambres mais gratuit a la réception
ne pas hesiter a demander des conseils a la réception pour les lieux a visiter

title: Sehr Sauber, guter Service, gute Lage
text: Sehr gute und einfache Unterkunft in zentraler Lage! Wir waren dort mit 3 Personen und wir haben uns dort sehr wohl gefühlt. Die Zimmer sind wirklich sehr groß und im Schlaf- und Wohnzimmer hängt jeweils ein Flat Fernseher.

title: Pratico
text: Ho pernottato una settimana in questo albergo che avevo prenotato su internet solo guardando alla posizione, sono rimasto invece felicemente sorpreso dall'accoglienza e dalla camera di grandi dimensioni, con anche una piccola cucina, buona la pulizia.

title: YOUR HOME IN MANHATTAN, GREAT SURPRISE!
text:
Great value for your money! Robert the doorman is great, friendly, very helpful and takes care of you as if you were at home! I usually stay in 4 star hotels in Manhattan -- which were fully booked last week due to the holidays -- and from now on I will make the Murray Hill East Suites
my standard NYC hotel. Furniture is old fashioned BUT 1)clean, 2)well maintained and 3)very functional. Our suite (2 rooms, kitchenette, bathroom) was very spacious, well iluminated, had a view of the Empire State, was very tidy and clean. The location is excellent (5' from Grand Central, grocery store at the corner, supermarket one block away, plenty of restaurants/pharmacies nearby) and still the street is not too noisy or crowdy. Having both a spacious desk to work, plus a table to eat, plus three big wardrobes made it possible to have all our stuff organized as if we were at home and not living out of a suitcases as you usually feel in a standard hotel room. Finally, we stayed three days at a similar hotel two blocks away on 39th (the Eastgate Towers) for the same price and expected a similar service/type of hotel, but the latter was a huge disappointment and totally run down. So, in case you look for a spacious suite, with a European, old-fashioned but cosy flair, very clean and with great service, then the Murray Hill East Suites is your best option in Manhattan!

title: Great location for Manhattan with spacious room
text: Recently, we stayed at the Murray Hill Suites East for one night. I booked it via Hotwire two days before our trip. The purpose of our trip was to shop and dine in the mid-town Manhattan area so this hotel is perfect. its about 15-20 minutes walk to time square and Macy. The parking garage is close by and only $25 per day with hotel validation, relatively inexpensive in Manhattan. We took the last room with two queen beds located at the 2nd floor facing the street. It was nosy, you could hear everything from the street traffic. It didn't border us since we were so tired after walking all day and we only stay for 1 night. Next time, I would definitely try to get a room at higher floor and facing the back of the building. Also, the hotel is dated and definitely need some renovation but its clean. Lastly, the room is huge for hotel in Manhattan. there is a separate sitting area and kitchen so its perfect for family with kids. I'd stay at this hotel again.

title: Hotel Correcto, Excelente situación
text:
Acabo de llegar de Nueva York donde he pasado unos días de vacaciones, Me he alojado en este Hotel, el cual he encontrado muy correcto, la habitación muy amplia y bien equipada con su cocina, comedor, sala de estar y cuarto de baño completo, es como estar en tu propia casa en Manhatan, el personal del Hotel muy amable y correcto, en todo momento había alguna persona que hablaba en Castellano, lo cual es muy util.
Su ubicación es excelente a pocos minutos se encuentra la Estación Gran Central desde donde puedes dirigirte a cualquier parte en metro, si te apetece caminar por la gran manzana la 5 avenida esta a 4 calles y desde alli tienes muy cerca el Rockefeller, Empire State etc. así como numerosas tiendas para efectuar compras.
Además muy cerca en la 3 Avenida hay un supermercado D' Agostino muy util, en el que hay de todo y puedes proveerte de alimentos para los desayunos y las cenas, lo cual hace que también esta parte del viaje te resulte mas económica.
Por poner alguna pega, la cama es un poco pequeña y le falta confort y en la cocina debería haber un microondas, por lo demás es perfecto.

title: Convenient, safe location
text:
My wife had visited NYC before, but this was our first visit together and staying in Manhattan. Being budget-conscious we booked this hotel on an online 'sight unseen' website, so there is a bit of lack of control in selecting the hotel. We reconciled the cost (over $250CAD per night) with the convenience of being mid-town. However, we were pleasantly surprised, given some older reviews. 

We arrived via the Airtransporter from La Guardia and were dropped off at Grand Central Terminal, about a five minute walk from the hotel. Our first impression of the staff was favourable and lasting - we found them polite and helpful. As we arrived mid-morning we stowed our bags and headed into the town. On our return later we found ourselves in suite #102 on the first (ground) floor, which featured an enclosed outdoor patio. The suite was a large living room (sofa, two armchairs, dining table and chairs, wall-mounted flat screen TV), large bedroom (king bed, plenty of closet space, wall-mounted flat screen TV), bathroom and small, equipped kitchen.

First of all, it was clean and warm. Decor is not 'modern', but not worn out either; our suite was fine, certainly for a few days in the city. It is roomy, so I think it would be comfortable for a longer stay. The kitchen was adequate - four settings of plates, cutlery, etc - and a dishwasher, fridge, microwave and gas stove. We only needed breakfast at the hotel (we came to see NYC, not the hotel!). However, apart from a kettle and a broil tray, I think it would be hard to 'cook' anything on the stove.

The bed was very comfortable (certainly had two thumbs up from my wife) and clean. There is a safe in a closet, but it was missing a lock of any sort. Fortunately this was not a problem for us, but if you wanted to secure your passports, cash, jewelry, etc it is a concern. We did not follow up with front desk as we didn't need it.

Location? Not bad at all, but be prepared to walk to mid-town attractions, or cab it. We found walking to be easy and interesting. Grand Central (5 minutes), Times Square (15 minutes), Macy's (15 minutes). Subway - north/south Lines 4,5 and 6 - go to either 33rd and Lexington (7 minutes) or Grand Central (42nd and Lexington - 5 minutes). Grocery store and liquor store on 3rd Avenue around the corner.

title: migliorato!!
text: Sono stata per la terza volta in questa struttura e devo dire che ho trovato dei grandi miglioramenti!!L'appartamento 503 era stato rinnovato con bella moquette pulizia giornaliera accurata e a differenza delle altre volte il personale ai piani e alla reception molto più disponibile e cordiale.Begli addobbi natalizi nella hall.Manca ancora la connessione wifi negli appartamenti e potrebbero dare qualche accessorio x la cucina in più (che comunque danno a richiesta )Da consigliare anche x la posizione

title: Great Location & Value in Manhattan!
text: Incredible value for excellent location.  You are close to many NYC attractions - feels like you are in your own (OK, more like your grandmother's) apartment, not a hotel - but that's OK...most people love their grandmother.   I have paid more for a much smaller hotel room, so if fancy and new is not super important to you, this is perfect.  Very friendly staff also.

title: No Complaints
text: We stayed for a week here in August 2012 when checking out daughter into NYU. Absolutely no complaints. Very clean, very easy to get around Manhattan from here, very nice staff. I really like this neighborhood. Quite at night, nice markets and a liquor store near by. Although if you're coming into or leaving town via Penn Station, it can hard to get cross town at certain times. Not the hotel's fault, just something to remember when planning.

title: Very spacious rooms.   Very dated.   Excellent Midtown location.   Superior value.
text:
Rooms are large.   King Bed.   Sofa two chairs and a round four top in the sitting area.   Spacious kitchen by Manhattan standards.   Lots of closet space.   Furniture and carpet are dated and worn but clean.   Linens are fresh. 

Outstanding value.   Convenient to Grand Central,  Bryant Park,  Empire State Building.

title: Great Location and large rooms!
text: I visit NYC the week after Thanksgiving every year with a friend I've known for 35 years. This is our 15th year and we have stayed in many hotels in just about every area of the city.   This hotel has become our favorite. The location is great, very close to Grand Central Station and easy walking distance to Macy's, Bryant Park, and many other places. The rooms are very large by NY standards and have a full kitchen. Great for economizing on breakfast and leftovers. It is an old hotel so the bathroom is small and the hair dryer is terrible (I suggest you bring your own) but the staff is great and you really can't beat the location. There are also some good restaurants close by--sam's Place and Fagioli's are both very good. We will be back again as long as their prices stay reasonable.

title: No Preparados ..... Malo
text: Buen lugar , central .... Pero no preparados para una emergencia , nos toco Huracan #Sandy y estuvimos 4-5 dias sin luz , agua , servicios el unico en el sector sin generador y ademas no ayudaban en la limpieza ... El gerente nunca estaba para ayudar, y dar respuesta como muchos otros lugares que reubicaron a pasajeros , Muy mala experiencia ...Aun esperando solucion a mi reclamo

title: Big suite
text: Gostei muito desse hotel, a localizaçao, os funcionarios atenciosos e eficientes, internet wifii free no loby muito rapida e principalmente o tamanho do quarto. Para os padroes de NY realmente um excelente custo X beneficio. Excelente !!! Recomendo

title: Spacious suites, great location
text:
I've stayed here twice, once with family and once solo. I love this hotel. The suites are clean and spacious. I don't even mind that the furniture is from the 1980s. Kitchen and bathroom big enough and clean. Windows are soundproof, but Manhattan is so loud it's better to stay on upper floors if street sounds bother you. Great location, about 7 minutes walk to Grand Central Station. The only downside is that you have to pay to use wi-fi in rooms. You can use it for free in the lobby, which often gets packed, so you have nowhere to sit.

When I was leaving New York, the hotel arranged the airport transfer for me. Both times they sent a limo! The transfer wasn't cheap, but it was 100% reliable (the last thing you want on the day you're travelling is a taxi company cancelling your airport transfer). 

The next time I visit New York, I'll stay in this hotel again.

title: Vonde senger og litt lang avstand til metro
text: Veldig stort hotellrom, men senga var en stor skuffelse. Altfor hard og uten overmadrass, så både jeg og mannen min fikk vondt i rygg og skuldre etter første natt. Ellers var rommet helt greit, men senga er ganske vesentlig. Også litt lang gangavstand til nærmeste metrostasjon. Vil ikke anbefale dette til andre.

title: Great location!
text: I stayed at the Penthouse (15th floor) and it has a spacious balcony with an amazing view of the Empire State building. Clean bathroom, nice kitchen and living room. Although the furniture are a bit old, they're clean and comfy. Just a few minutes walk to the Chrysler building, Bryant park, and the Grand Central Station. The doorman was very polite. The elevator is small and old but at least it still feels safe.

title: Buena ubicación y cómodo
text:
Cerca de la Central Station la hace muy práctica ya que, desde esta estación se puede ir a cualquier lado.
Cómodo, la habitación muy espaciosa. 
El botones fue muy amable y servicial. 
Es super recomendable. 
La única crítica es que tienen wifi sólo en el lobby.

title: MUY CONFORTABLE EN EL CORAZÓN DE MANHATTAN
text:
Murray Hill East Suites es un apart hotel situado en el corazón de Manhattan, muy cerca del Chrysler Building, se puede ir a pie a Times Square, a 3 cuadras de la 5th Ave, muy cerca de la Central Station, por ende, fácilmente comunicable por metro a todo NYc.
El apartamento es muy amplio, con buenos y cómodos muebles, para 4 personas tuvimos un dormitorio muy amplio, con buenos placares, aire acondicionado, LCD, y un living muy grande, con un sofá cama de más de dos plazas, mesas de luz, cómoda, otro LCD, aire acondicionado.
En esa habitación estaba la zona comedor, con mesa y sillas, y aparte, una cocina totalmente equipada, que se podía usar de manera independiente de los dormitorios.
El baño, completo, con bañera, utilísimo para hacerse baños de inmersión después de horas de caminar por NYC. 
A una cuadra y media hay un supermercado bien provisto. 
Lo único malo es que cobran la internet en la habitación. Conviene alquilar internet por un mes, no importa la estadía, así es más barato.
Tiene lavandería en el sótano, accesible y fácil de manejar.
El personal es muy servicial, y siempre algún empleado habla español.
ALTAMENTE RECOMENDABLE PARA VIAJAR EN FAMILIA.

title: Good pied-a-terre in NYC
text: You cannot hope to have such a spacious suite at this price elsewhere in mid-town Manhattan, a few short blocks from the Grand Central Terminal. The property is dated but well maintained, with good-size kitchen and spacious living/dining room, and is perfectly comfortable for a weekend or an extended stay.

title: Great place in NYC
text: We arrived three days after hurricane sandy and came with a bit of concerns, however as we got there all our fears were gone! The hotel is great, the location is perfect, the service is extremely nice and polite and the rooms were great. I read reviews stating the rooms are a bit dated, we didnt find it so true, it may not be the hilton or the four seasons but its a great place in midtown NYC!!

title: great location and fair price
text:
I must preface this review with the fact that I arrived on the same day that the hotel regained electricity after hurricane Sandy hit New York.  My hotel room was fine considering they were just getting the hotel back in order and it improved immensely the following day when the hotel was fully operational.  The staff were helpful and polite.  

The central location of Murray Hill suites is very convenient to move around Manhattan.  The rooms are spacious and the small kitchenette is perfect for a quick coffee and breakfast.  The bed is much softer than I am used to and probably should be replaced.  The room was quiet and comfortable, and the price reasonable for New York.  The extra daily charge for internet in the room was a nuisance.  However, I would definitely recommend Murray Hill Suites and book again.

title: recomendable 100%
text: una excelente relación precio calidad y una atención profesional. todo estaba de acuerdo a lo ofrecido no tuve sorpresas desagradables. limpieza excelente. la ubicación es algo retirada pero tranquila la zona

title: Fantastic experience
text: My daughter and I reserved a room at the Murray Hill East Suites months ago, but reservations happened to be for Nov. 3 (the week of Sandy in NYC).  All week, I tried to contact the hotel, but the phone lines were down and we were unsure that the hotel would even be open.  We took a chance and did not try to find another hotel.  When we arrived, the hotel was up and running will power.  To say the room was large isn't enough.  It was huge...a double bed, two nightstands, a desk, round table w/two chairs, a sofa and end tables, a comfy chair, refrigerator, stove, sink, utensils, dinnerware, a full, clean bathroom.  It was amazing!  It was a quiet room overlooking a courtyard.  The front desk was helpful and there was a small, clean lobby where we had our lunch before we could check in.  We were very pleased with our stay at Murray Hill East Suites, so convenient to everything in NYC and located in a quiet part of the city.  We made our reservations through Hotwire.

title: Won't stay here againg.
text: I have to say the new york hotel are very expensive. I booking the room in booking with good discount. however, it's still cost over 200 USD/NIGHT with bad services. Everyday I can find the others hair in bath towerl.  I am very wondering if they are reuse the dirty towel without clean.  The location are very good that near the grand center station. I can easy go to visit time suqare, emper building by walking. Also there are 2 chinse restaurant very near the hotel.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text: estuve con mi marido y mis hijas en diciembre en el Murray hills y nos parecio espectacular. El departamento era muy bueno y prolijo. La cocina muy completa. Los empleados del lobby muy serviciales. Esta muy bien ubicado ya que se puede llegar caminando a Broadway y esta cerca de la grand central station. Muy recomendable!!!

title: For the price, clean, comfortable, great location
text: I stayed here in October in a queen bed room on the second floor for $170 per night. The hotel and the room were clean. The bed was comfortable. It was also quiet -we didn't hear any traffic noise. I didn't realize the room came with a little kitchenette with about four each of plates, glasses, etc, plus a few pots and pans. That would be very helpful on a longer visit. The hotel is about four block from Grand Central Station, so we could get everywhere we wanted to go. Times Square was about a 15 minute walk. There were a lot of budget eating options in the several block radius around the hotel.

title: A for location, F for everything else.
text:
I stayed here to attend a conference nearby. The price and location were great. Everything else was not so great. This must have been an old studio apartment building that has been repurposed as a hotel. Everything smelled of stale cigarettes both in my room and in the common areas. I never unpacked my suitcase during my stay, just to try and keep my clothes from absorbing that smell. It didn't work. 
My room was 100% 1980's decor. That's a long time to go without any remodelling.

title: Muy buena opción
text: Hace 3 días regresé de un viaje por N. York y Miami. En el primer lugar me alojé en este hotel, en una de sus suites junior y realmente tienen todo lo necesario para pasar una estadía muy agradable en una ciudad de ensueño como es N. York. En principio la ubicación es buena, ya que estás cerca de la Grand Central Station, por lo que de allí te podés comunicar con muchos lados. Además está  a pocas cuadras de la 5a. avenida, por la que podrás recorrer toda esa zona y llegar en pocos minutos a Times Square, al Moma, al Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall y muchas otras atracciones que quieras visitar. Para referirme al interior del apartamento, debo decir que tiene una cocina con todo lo imprescindible para su uso, como cocina, microondas, tostadora, heladera y todo lo demás necesario. Luego tiene un living comedor con un televisor plasma de 32", en una plataforma móvil que te permite direccionarlo para cualquier parte del apartamento. Una cama de 2 plazas, que esto sí podría ser un poco más grande. Un buen baño con amenities para todo y placares varios. Además tiene cofre fort de fácil acceso, para lo que no hay que hacer un curso de uso, como en otros lugares que he visitado. También hay limpieza diaria, que es muy buena. Creo que con todo esto no se necesita más nada para disfrutar N. York. Me faltó agregar la buena disposición de la gente de recepción que están siempre atentos a las necesidades del turista.

title: Best buy for your money!
text: Great location that is safe. You can walk to everything. Great staff! Clean and a very large space for your money. Have stayed there before and am never disappointed.  I was on the upper floor and had a perfect view of the Empire State Building all lit up at night.

title: Super
text:
Nous avons été agréablement surpris par la localisation (pres de la gare principale et des navettes aéroports) et surtout la propreté et la superficie des chambres.
en point négatif je noterai le simple vitrage (additionné aux travaux dans la rue pour notre part).
En revanche, le WIFI était payant lors de notre passage...

title: First class Hotel, First class location.
text: Stayed here, room 401, 7th Sep - 11th Sept 2012 whilst celebrating our daughter's 18th Birthday. Our first time in New York and were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room, which was kept immaculate by the maid despite the amount of shopping that was done! The staff in reception couldn't have been more helpful even though we managed to break the bath plug on the first night!  Wi-Fi is free in the reception area, not in the room. The safety deposit box is free, just leave a deposit for the key. Location was great, just around the corner from Grand Central Station. Would thoroughly recommend to all.

title: Great location
text: Stayed for 2 nights in July.  I got a really good deal on an Orbitz sale and was very happy with the facility and location.  Walk to everything and really good restaurants all around.  Dagastino's supermarket is around the corner so you can "cook at home" in your suite if you want to save a bit.  No free WiFi in the rooms so the lobby is almost always full!

title: La mejor elección
text:
Fuimos 4 amigas. El apart súper cómodo, cocina con lavavajillas, microndas, living amplio y habitación espectacular. TV LCD 42" en living y dormitorio. Excelente ubicación, zona muy tranquila. El personal del front desk muy amable y hablan español. Dispuestos a solucionar cualquier inconveniente que pudiera suceder. Posee un subsuelo con lavandería (con monedas) y sala de gym. Servicio de limpieza diario al igual que el cambio de toallas. A la vuela un supermercado, lo que permite comprar y desayunar en el apart y también cenar,después de horas de caminatas.
Altamente recomendable

title: Great location but uncomfortable beds.
text:
The beds are lumpy and slope to the side so that you have the sensation of sliding out. The mattress is coveted in a noisy plastic that crunches every time you move. The plastic also makes one perspire a lot. 
The bathroom was very clean but the shower head did not spray properly. The stove worked but the oven did not. No microwave so we were unable to heat food. 
The location was great and the staff helpful and friendly. 
I thought the hotel was overpriced but this is NY.

title: Palazzo di appartamenti centralissimo
text: Ho soggiornato al Murray Hill per una settimana lo scorso agosto, il nostro appartamento (eravamo in 4) era composto di una cucina, un soggiorno molto grande  (con divano letto), una stanza da letto ed un bagno. L'appartamento nel complesso è molto confortevole, la zona giorno abbastanza grande da fungere sia da sala da pranzo che da camera da letto per due persone, il bagno piccolo ma con tutto il necessario. La pulizia ineccepibile, passavano una volta al giorno e oltre a pulire cambiavano sempre anche la biancheria nei bagni. La reception è attiva h24 e sono stati sempre molto disponibili. Inoltre la posizione è ottima, a due minuti a piedi dalla 5th avenue, da Grand Central Station e a 10 minuti a piedi da Times Square. Il prezzo, tutto considerato, non è assolutamente alto. Lo consiglio decisamente.

title: Goed hotel op een goede plaats
text: In juni 2012 in dit hotel geweest, prima plek vlakbij station met metro en bussen. Er rijden bussen vanaf de verschillende luchthavens naar Grand Central Station en dan is het maar een paar minuten lopen. Ruime kamer met kleine keuken, tafel en stoelen en bank en een prima en schoon bed. Goede prijs/ kwaliteit verhouding.

title: Home away from home in NYC
text: Murray Hill is a quiet residential neighborhood in mid-town Manhattan.  Murray Hill Suites is a charming quiet boutique hotel.  We've stayed there at least 6 times over several years and loved it.  The penthouse is WONDERFUL!!!  The staff are pleasant and accommodating.  Price is great!

title: Great location and value
text: We stayed here on the final phase of our epic trip. A great location being near to grand central so handy for NYC sightseeing. We had a one bedroomed suite with kitchen (enormous!) and very comfy sofa bed.very nice staff they kept our bags until 4. Wifi reliable and lovely shower.kitchen had lots of utensils but we kept getting take away food from fantastic local delis - every food imaginable. Airport buse are a few minutes away I wish we were there now.

title: super séjour
text:
des chambres très spacieuses, une vraie cuisine complète, bien isolé (ce qui est très important à new york), la clim marche bien, wifi gratuit dans le hall, personnel sympa, la décoration n'est pas toute neuve mais rien n'est sale ou cassé juste ancien. De plus je trouve que l’hôtel à ce style ancien qui est agréable puisqu'il y est confortable et propre. 
Le mieux reste la situation : à 5min de Grand Central Station, d'où l'on peut se rendre partout dans Manhattan et Brooklyn, nous sommes très content de notre choix.

title: huge rooms with kitchenette
text: If you are looking for a hotel with all the services and amenities, then this is not for you. However, this hotel in mid-town east gives you a huge room for new york, including a kitchenette. Its not the most modern but was certainly comfortable. The staff in the reception were very helpful

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
Booked the room through hotwire.  After reading the reviews, I was a bit nervous.  No need.  The location was great, walkable to Time Square and plenty of restaurants in the area.  

The room itself was huge by NYC standards.   We had a suite with a separate bedroom and living room.  Also, has a small kitchen as well.  Would definitely stay there again with the whole family.

It is a bit dated, but the size, loaction and price more than compensate.

title: Non è oro tutto quello che luccica
text:
Ottima posizione ma per tutto il resto è da scartare:
- le stanze che danno sulla strada sono rumorose  specialmente di notte;
- il personale non è per niente disponibile avevamo chiesto di cambiare la stanza in quanto nonostante avevamo prenotato una camera per fumatori e ci hanno fornito una per non fumatori. Quando abbiamo richiesto la sostituzione hanno risposto che era possibile in quanto al completo. Nel mentre abbiamo visto arrivare e partire diverse comitive (la nostra permanenza è stata di 7 giorni) con un po' di buona volontà avrebbero potuto accontentarci. 
- la pulizia non è stata capillare;
- la cucina poco dotata
Complessivamente la struttura necessita di una ripulita salvo diminuire il prezzo.
L'unico aspetto positivo è l'ubicazione che permette di girare Manatthan a piedi

title: Buen equilibrio
text:
Tiene una buena ubicación, aunque un poco alejado de Times Square (20 minutos caminando), que es la zona que tiene vida por la noche. Tiene un supermercado a la vuelta, D`Agostino, que es buenísimo para las compras del desayuno o eventualmente comida ya preparada para la cena. La limpieza es muy buena, las camas bien cómodas, espacios amplios, algo difícil de conseguir en NY. Nuestra habitación quedaba en el piso 7 al final del pasillo, y la señal de wifi (que encima habíamos pagado) era terrible! Hay wifi gratis en la recepción, por la tarde están los turistas sentados ocupando todos los sillones. Le vendría muy bien una redecoración, la decoración actual es bien cargada, tipica de los 80.
Nota excéntrica: el taxi que nos pidieron en el hotel para ir al aeropuerto era.... una limousina!!

title: Great location for a great price!!
text: My wife and I booked this hotel through hotwire. Once we booked it I read every review I could and had the expectation of the hotel to be outdated but a good place to lay your head at night. When my wife and I arrived we were both extremely please with the size of the room.
