The fridge and kitchenette were great for any food you wanted to bring back from dinner or buy at the markets down the street (3rd Ave). The bed was comfortable, the AC worked, and the TV worked so it made for a great place to wind down and relax after a long day of walking. I found the hotel staff to be very helpful and polite. I would recommend this hotel to anybody because you really get a great place to stay for a cheap price considering its Manhattan. If we go back to NYC we would definitely want to stay here again.

title: Good location, reasonable price for a suite, but check your room type
text:
On the plus side the location was very good, in a quiet street (for New York) being close to Grand Central, the UN and the Empire State Building, of which we had a great view from our window.  The suite was clean and the main living room was a good size and we didn't feel at all cramped which is unusual in a city centre hotel.  The reception staff I spoke to were very helpful as were the doormen.

Improvements? The room was a bit 'tired', especially the kitchen but nothing that was really off-putting, it just needed a bit of a facelift.  
One odd thing that didn't work was the safe which was missing its lock.
However the big negative factor was the attitude of one of the hotel staff with whom I dealt by phone and email.  I made the booking 8 months ahead of our trip specifically because the hotel offered suites with 2 double beds and a sofa bed so my 2 teenage sons and I could each have our own beds.  When I telephoned the hotel a month before our arrival to check everything was in order I was surprised to be told they couldn't guarantee the room type as it depended on what was available on the day. I was stunned. This was 7 months after I'd made the reservation. It was too late to book anywhere else for a reasonable price.  Two weeks before arrival I emailed to remind them of our booking type and repeated the day before.  Fortunately we got the room type when we arrived, but the next day I was amazed to receive an email form the person I spoke to basically telling me it was only a request not a booking.  The tone was so contrary to good customer service I hope the vperson doesn't do that to everyone.  If that is representative of the hotel's attitude they won't stay in business much longer.  The person's attitude cast a shadow over the whole month before our arrival. Be careful if you think you are guaranteed a specific room type!

title: Spacious and clean
text:
This hotel is perfect for a family or for people who want an apartment-style hotel It is not fancy, but is in a good location re: subway and Bloom's Deli  for breakfast
It is about a fifteen minute walk to Times Square 
Helpful concierge staff were great at getting taxis for you when necessary.

We were even upgraded from a studio to a one-bedroom suite. Asking helps!!
Rena

title: Espaço,conforto e presteza!!! Excelente para família!!!!
text: Adoramos esse hotel! Relação custo x beneficio ok. Espaço e conforto são palavras que definem bem as acomodações, principalmente se tratando de NY, onde a maioria dos hoteis possuem quartos diminutos. Fomos em família e achamos perfeito!!! Sala com um sofá-cama grande que acomoda  dois, um quarto com cama king, uma mini cozinha, banheiro e muitos armários e tv led nos dois ambientes, tábua e ferro de passar, amenites. Limpeza e troca de toalhas diárias e tratamento simpático e cortez. Realmente fez a diferença nas nossas férias. Quanto a localização, não fica no buchicho, mas fica três quadras da Grand Central, estação de metrô o que é perfeito para locomoção pela ilha. Adoramos e ficaremos lá em outras viagens à NY.

title: Ottima posizione
text: L’arredamento dell’intera struttura è un po’ antico, molto stile anni ’70 con la moquette che tappezza quasi tutto, tranne il bagno ovviamente!!! Nell’insieme, comunque, le stanze sono abbastanza gradevoli ed accoglienti. La mia era un mono-locale abbastanza grande dotato di letto matrimoniale king size e comprensivo di angolo cottura, utile se si è stanchi e si vuole consumare un pasto in camera in tutta tranquillità. Vicino l’albergo ci sono, infatti, numerose tavole calde a prezzi decisamente economici e tra la 3rd avenue e la 39th street c’è un supermercato, D’agostino mi pare!! L’albergo offre anche un servizio di lavanderia a pagamento: mi sembra che sia possibile fare una lavatrice con circa 3 $. Inoltre, ci sono asse e ferro da stiro in ogni camera. Per i transfer da e per l’aeroporto, essendo in 4, abbiamo utilizzato uno dei 200000 di taxi che girano per NY, spendendo ogni volta 50 $ (credo sia una quota fissa). Volendo è possibile prendere delle navette al costo di 12$ a persona, ma il punto di arrivo non è vicinissimo all’albergo e tra bagagli, buste e bustine di vario tipo potrebbe essere scomodo. Il maggior punto di forza di questa struttura resta comunque la posizione: è ubicato in una zona centralissima a breve distanza dalla Grand Central Station. E’ praticamente piena di uffici, quindi la sera ed il fine settimana è molto tranquilla. I week-end, inoltre, vicino l’albergo, chiudono una parte della 41th street che si riempe di chioschi ambulanti che vendono soprattutto spiedini di carne e hot dog. Si sente in strada un odorino fantastico!! In linea di massima, comunque,  consiglio vivamente il Murray Hill East: se dovessi tornare a Manhattan, probabilmente alloggerei nuovamente qui!

title: Apart con servicio de hotel
text:
Contratamos 3 amigas este hotel el cual contaba con una cocina totalmente equipada (helad, cocina, microondas, lavavajillas, tostadora, vajilla completa). Le dimos mucha utilidad para no tener q salir apenas levantada a desayunar, pues lo hacíamos allí, al igual que muchas noches al volver extenuadas, comprabamos comida y cenábamos comodamente en el Hotel-Apart.
El dpto. espacioso, luminoso y muy limpio. Una opción muy práctica.

title: Very quiet and spacious by NYC standards
text: We stayed here for the second part of a 2 and half week stay in NYC.  We had been scammed by a rental apartment 'owner' upon arriving in NCY and needed accommodation in a hurry (yes, all the forums are accurate about the rent scams in NYC, the scammers even exist on Tripadvisor as we found out.  Our scammer didn't provide the accommodation but kept AU$2368, we're still trying to get our money back and may never see it again and the woman continues to advertise another property on Tripadvisor, this time In Phoenix Arizona, so be careful!).  We also stayed in a couple of othe hotels in NYC, the Murray Hill East Suites studio apartment (Junior suite room 301) we stayed in was excellent and not much more per night than the original apartment we were scammed out of.  Staff were helpful, room was clean with pleny of natural light and very spacious by NY standards.  We had a kitchenette (don't expect to cook gourmet meals in there, but ample for preparing breakfast and snacks).  Strangely the kitchenette has a full size stove and oven but no microwave, although to be fair it would be hard to find room for one.  There is a small fridge and a coffee maker with tea/coffee, sugar and creamer supplied.  A toaster turned up on about day 3, thank you to the housemaid staff.  Bathroom was sparkling clean.  Plenty of wardrobe space so we didn't have to live out of our suitcases.  Only complaint about the room was the bed wasn't the most comfortable and our 10 year old son slept on the sofa-bed which he complained was uncomfortable, but he survived.  I don't think it would have been tolerable for an adult to sleep on it.  No ubiquitous NY bed bugs either, so that was a bonus.  Free wi-fi in the lobby only, with paid wi-fi in rooms.  Plenty of places to eat nearby, also a Bodega on the corner for supplies.  Nearest subway just a couple of blocks away at Grand Central Station so very easy to get around.  We would stay there again.

title: Great location and good service
text: Very spacious rooms, great location, really GOOD price!, and in Manhattan better. I went there for a family reunion we booked to rooms the 807 and the 408, there wasn’t a closer room so we had to take dose separated rooms, but it was ok. Both of the rooms had an equip kitchen and separated from the bedrooms and the living room, a sofa bed and two full beds. My only complain was that the rooms had bad odor, please check that out, but the rest of it was great. Little GYM but with everything you need.

title: Fantastic!
text:
Great place to stay, great value for money. Spacious studio, full kitchen. Polite staff. Surrounded by Dagostino supermarket, restaurants and take-aways on 3rd Ave. Try the pizzas on 3rd Ave near 39 st corner!
 3 blocks from Grand central subway. 
The only critics is that there's free wi-fi only in the lobby. Also, the morning receptionist could be more polite and do her best...
In your room is expensive.
There is a laundry room in the basement where you can wash and dry clothes for U$ 7.

title: Instalaciones "setentosas" pero limpio y una increble ubicación.
text: Muy buenos precios y gran ubicación para recorrer Manhattan, a metros del Chrysler Building y de la Grand Central Station . Es verdad que no es moderno, pero que más se puede pedir. En la esquina hay un almacén y a la vuelta un super que vende un sushi de primera. Tiene lavandería en el sótano con lavarropas y secarropas a monedas, y si solo tienes billetes hay un dspenser de monedas. El wiFi es gratis en el lobby pero pago en las habitaciones. No tiene servicio de desayuno pero tenés café en la habitación, pero como es un appart, tenés tu heladera y cocina.

title: meraviglioso
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questa struttura per 7 giorni durante una vacanza con la famiglia, ne siamo entusiasti e sicuramente se tornassimo a N.Y  torneremmo al  Murray Hill - posizione eccellente, abbiamo raggiunto quasi tutto a piedi - io non ho riscontrato nessun problema di pulizia anzi con un bambino devo dire che la sera ritrovavo sempre lo studio molto pulito - la cucina e' fornitissima e permette di preparare tranquillamente qualcosa se si e' stanchi e non si desidera uscire - il personale e' molto cortese e disponibile - consigliatissimo a famiglie cn bambini -

title: Ubicación a buen precio
text: Muy bien situado, con calidad-precio excepcional y habitaciones amplias y cómodas. El único problema, el wifi de pago, pero es gratuito en el lobby. El personal, muy atento y habla español también. Muy recomendable.

title: Superbra hotell. Rek. till alla.
text: Vi reste i början av juni-12. Ett väldigt bra val av hotell som jag garanterat kan åka till igen. Det va rent, välstädat, fräscha sängkläder, bra säng och toaletten var ren. Köket var väl inte jättemodernt, men det fanns kylskåp, kaffebryggare, spis och porslin. Rummet städades varje dag. Platt tv och stort vardagsrum. Va lite skeptiskt först när vi bara betalade 5000 / per person i juni (bokade i mars) men allt va verkligen jättebra. vi bodde på vån 2 så vi hade gratis WiFi från lobbyn som nådde upp till oss. annars tilläggsavg. på några dollar. det fanns aircond samt värdefack på rummet, strkjärn m.m. . bra personal. sov gott om natten. Låg nära till flera mataffärer där vi köpte med oss frukost mat och åt på rummet. ligger när tunnelbana och sevärdheter (som de flesta hotell på manhattan...) osv. kommer gärna hit igen.Tar ca 5o min med taxi från JFK. Ligger bredvid  Grand central samt Chrysler building.

title: excelente prestacion ¡¡¡¡
text: Muchas virtudes, conserjes que hablan español, ambientes amplios y generosos, funcionan todos los elementos de la cocina, muy bien de utensillos, limpieza y pulcritud, LCD en los dos ambientes, muy buena ubicacion . LO unico, los ascensores un poco lentos. Buena relacion precios/prestacion  . Volveria todas las veces que fuese  N York.

title: I could have stayed all day...
text:
We hadn't been in this hotel for a couple of years, but got a bargain last weekend when we went to the theater.
The place is wonderful. We had a suite on the 4th floor. Quiet. Good view. Clean. Spacoius. And the staff, as usual, was really helpful and courteous. 
It's pretty convenient to Grand Central and buses to just about anywhere. I would have loved to stay an extra day or two just to hang out and read in the room...

title: Discreto l'hotel. ottimo avere l'angolo cottura
text:
Hotel discreto e in ottima posizione. 
Noi avevamo preso un stanza matrimoniale con angolo cottura e ci siamo trovati bene. 
L'unica pecca è l'arredamento e la struttura rimasti agli anni 70. Per quegli anni sarebbe stato il top, all'occhio moderno invece lo fa sembrare cupo e antiquato. Moquette ovunque.
Ottima cosa avere l'angolo cottura per poter mangiare "in casa" tra hot-dogs e cene abbastanza dispendiose al ristorante. 
Pulizia delle camere abbastanza superficiale, concentrandosi sulle zone ben visibili e trascurando parecchio quelle meno visibili (sotto il letto ecc)
Internet wi-fi gratuito solo nella hall, altrimenti a pagamento nelle stanze... antiquato!
Grand Central Station a due passi.

title: Incredibly spacious and great location
text: We booked a studio room through hotels.com and We stayed here for 6 nights. The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable, much bigger than expected, which was a great surprise, especially in NYC. divided into two separate spaces by a built-in door, with a large living-dining room area as one space and the bedroom as the other. All the room was carpeted, but the carpet was in very good condition in most of the  room. The furniture is old but functional and spacious, and there is plenty of storage place for your personal belongings (chest drawers, two closets, etc). There is a safe in the room where you can store all sensible belongings. The TV is new, LCD flat screen with free cable but internet is paid wi-fi, except in the lobby where is free. The integrated dining area has a small round table with few chairs but for two people was ok. The living room had one large and one small sofás, very comfortable. The kitchenette was quite old, with few basic ítems: a small refrigerator, a coffee-maker, silverware, glasses and plates for 4 people and cookingware for most needs. No toaster was provided until last day, and the condition of the one we got was very old and worn-out. The bathroom was great! Mostly new, all tiled with a bath tub with excellent water pressure, a huge mirror and very good amenities, including a walled hair-dryer. The bed, although not a King size as expected, was a comfortable Queen size, with plenty of pillows. The AC was not fully functional, it was more a fan than AC, and probably would be an issue if you travel in the hot summer (We did not need it so it was ok). The hotel staff was very nice, there is always somebody in the lobby, which makes it safe when you come back late in the night. Location is great! There are a lot of convenience stores and supermarkets, and the nearest subway station is 3 blocks away in Grand Central Station. The rest of the experience in this wonderful city is up to you! We know will be back and would definitely recommend and consider staying at this property again.

title: Worked Well for Us
text: We wanted a hotel near Grand Central for my husbamd and I and two of our adult children for two nights, and then adding in our granddaughter for the third night, and this turned out to be the ideal place.  We could easily walk to the station and also to restaurants, shops, and the wonderful Morgan Library.  We had a one bedroom suite with two beds in the bedroom and a fold-out couch in the living room, and a very spacious and fully equipped kitchen.  Everything was clean and in good condition, and the rooms were larger than those in most hotels.  The hotel was busy, but it was always quiet in our suite.  Staff were particularly helpful and friendly, the price we paid was quite reasonable for what we got, and we would definitely stay again.

title: Not Awful, Not Great!
text:
I just returned from a 4-night stay at the Murray Hill East Suites, booked as a package deal through Priceline.  We arrived early and were told that a room wasn't ready, but after sitting in the lobby for about 10 minutes, the lady at the check-in desk called me over to tell me they had one available.  She was very sweet and helpful; there was another one that was not so friendly.  The room itself was OK - it was straight out of the 80's in decor and the furniture was a bit worn around the edges, but it seemed clean.  The door to the bathroom wouldn't close all the way, and the kitchenette oddly had a gas stove, but no microwave.  Neither of the bedside lights worked, and I was told that they would send someone up to check them out, but it was never fixed during the entire stay.  Free wifi was only available in the lobby, there was no business center, and I was told that they would not print boarding passes, which seemed strange since they had no computer there to print them ourselves!

All in all, the stay was fine, but nothing special.  The nearest subway is about 3 blocks away at Grand Central, and there are several shops nearby to pick up any food items you might need.  The neighborhood is fairly quiet, but there is scaffolding over the front entrance right now, and there was some construction noise during the day, but only on the weekdays.  I would consider staying again if the price was right, but there are several other budget-type hotels that I prefer over the Murray Hill East Suites.

title: Bien ubicado
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado, apenas a unos 5 minutos  (a pie) de la Gran Estacion y a 10 del Empire State. Las habitaciones bien equipadas y limpias, aunque algunas camas necesitan renovacion.  Pero tomando en cuenta los altos precios de hospedaje en Manhattan esta bien para un viaje familiar. No tiene Internet sino en la recepcion, lo cual es incomodo y el personal de Front Desk  es muy poco amable.

title: Fantastic!!
text: My daughter and I stayed at Murray Hill for the first time, We loved it!! It was in a nice area quaint and quite after a long day of shopping and sightseeing, The staff was very friendly, rooms were clean and lots of room. We will definately tell our friend and family about this little gem in New York!!

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Nos recomendaron el hotel por la ubicación y fue tal cual nos habían contado. Confortable, el personal siempre dispuesto , hasta algunos de ellos hablaban español. El servicio de limpieza fue excelente.
La crítica es que si se paga una habitación para 4 adultos, se debería suponer que wi fi de la habitación, pago, tendría que aceptar una capacidad de 4 aparatos para conectarse  y en este hotel sólo permitian el acceso a 2.

title: Excelente Ubicacion y Comodidad
text:
Era mi primer visita a N,York. Buscaba un Apart bien ubicado, cerca de de la 5ta avenida, y me ofrecieron este hotel. Justo con todo a lo cual aspiraba, y mas todavia. Tiene amplios ambientes. La cama un placer. Al baño y la cocina no le falta nada. Todos los dias te dejan  café y te, para el desayuno o la merienda. Limpian y cambian las sabanas todos los días. Los estudios  y las suites disponen de caja fuerte, escritorio, TV por cable y zona de estar. Además, están equipados con sofá cama y lavavajillas. El personal de recepción es atento y amable ante cualquier consulta, y algunos de ellos hablan el español. El Murray Hill East Suites cuenta con un gimnasio, conexión Wi-Fi gratuita en las zonas comunes Esta muy bien ubicado. Cerca de todo para ir caminando. La Estación Gran Central a pocos minutos caminando. Lugar donde llegan y salen todos los transportes desde y hacia los aeropuertos. También de lugares de interés como el Rockefeller Center, Time Square y el Empire State. Hay un buen supermercado a 100 mt. para comprar todo lo que se necesite para el desayuno o comidas ligeras. Hay tambien cerca restaurantes y lugares para comer y comprar comida para llevar. Todo a precios muy acomodados. 
Nuestra estadía en N.York fue fantástica, y muy cómoda gracias al Murray. Tiene el mejor costo para las prestaciones de su servicio. Volveremos pronto.

title: Muy buena relación precio calidad
text:
Fuimos a una habitación para 3 personas (Difícil de encontrar en un hotel en NYC). La primera impresión superó ampliamente nuestras expectativas, la habitación es MUY espaciosa, el sofá cama que era para la tercera persona era de 2 plazas y tan cómodo como una cama, tv LCD en ambas habitaciones, laundry a muy buenos precios, la limpieza muy buena y a pesar de que estábamos al lado de una obra jamás escuchamos algún ruido, las camas y almohadas de primer nivel y la cocina al nivel de la de una casa... heladera, horno común y microhondas, vajilla. 
La ubicación del hotel es muy buena y se nota que estan todo el tiempo implementando mejoras (Estaban remodelando la habitación frente a la nuestra el día que nos ibamos).
La atención es esmerada y muy medida. Es una opción MUY recomendable.

title: Acqua e sapone
text:
Abbiamo scelto questo hotel su internet, per lavoro  ci serviva una stanza grande con un salottino possibilmente nell'east side.il Murray soddisfava tutte le nostre attese.
Le stanze sono grandissime,abbastanza spoglie, ma con una cucina fornitissima, 
Il problema di questo albergo è peró  la pulizia: moquette polverosa che ulula "cambiami cambiami!!!!" un odorino fra il vecchio e la muffa dovunque ed un gran bisogno di una passata di aspirapolvere.
Una speciale menzione all'ascensore , di una lentezza esasperante da non consigliare alle donne incinte che potrebbero partorire prima di arrivare.
Insomma un peccato perchè basterebbe una robusta dose di ramazza acqua e sapone per fare di questo albergo un vero gioiellino

title: Best value for your money
text:
We stayed at this hotel back in February 2012 for a week and it certainly provided us with value.

The rooms were larger then I expected, with a sitting area, in addition to a dinning table. A small kitchenette tucked off to the side provided us with great meal flexibility. While we still had the option to eat out, we made use of it once or twice in an effort to mitigate the overall cost of our trip. As someone who spends the majority of their time out of the hotel when travelling, the room size always has been the most important part of travel. I enjoy lounging after a long day of walking Manhattan end to end. In terms of location, this hotel was place perfectly. A five minute walk to Grande Central Station provided us easy access to the metro.

There was nothing particularly exceptional about the service of the staff, it was on par with what you'd expect. We arrived early on the first night, and the staff said they would get our room ready faster, and allowed us to store our luggage at the hotel until it was ready. There was no free wifi available in the rooms (there was for a fee). There was, however, free wifi in the main lobby. It was a touch annoying running downstairs with our laptops.

My main gripe about this hotel was the elevator. An odd thing to complain about, but I've seen molasses move quicker. We were "lucky" enough to get one of the highest floors. By the end of our trip, that luck felt more like a curse. We had to ride those infernal contraptions that much longer, being stopped every other floor!

All in all, a very good experience at this hotel. I have, and will recommend to others in the future. In terms of value for your dollar, this hotel is really a no brainer.

title: MUY BUENA OPCION
text: estuve en dos oportunidades en este hotel y para los precios en NYC es muy buena opción. la ubicación es muy buena, a tres cuadras de la estación central de subtes. se puede llegar caminando a muchos lugares de interés. zona segura. el cuarto es grande y aunque la deco es antigua es muy limpio.

title: Honest appraisal of our recent stay
text: My girlfriend and I wanted to spend ten days in Manhattan together, arriving on 12th April 2012. She lives in Arizona and I live in Ireland so we decided to look online. We wanted to find studio suite-type accommodation where there would be a kitchen, thereby enabling us to save money by cooking someof our own meals, have breakfast each day etc. We spent a long time trying to find somewhere suitable that was available because a lotof accommodation was already booked up or way too expensive. Eventually my girlfriend found theMurray Hill East Suites on booking.com. The online booking process was straightforward. We both arrived into Newark and took a yellow taxi from the airport. The $88 fare was, we thought, very expensive mostly because the price is never the price in the US. Extras always seem to get added on (e.g. in this case for tolls, baggage etc). Then the driver expects a 10% tip on top. We discovered that it is much better to use the airport buses which are located at Park Avenue/Grand Central Station (for JFK and La Guardia) and at 41st Street/Lexington (for Newark). When we were leaving Manhattan, the bus only cost $16 per person in total. Anyway, on 12th April we arrived into the hotel and were happy enough with the reception/checking in process. The lobby itself is quite spacious with some sofas and lounge chairs. Our room was on the 5th floor overlooking 39th Street. The accommodation consistedof one large-ish living/dining/bed room measuring about 24’ x 16’. There was a large double bed and a dining table, two chairs, two-seater sofa, flat screen TV, writing desk and chair and a chestof drawers. Overall, the decor in this room was very dated, dull and drab and we felt it seriously needed a make-over. Also, we did not really like the nylon bed sheets – cotton would have been so much more comfortable. One good thing was that the room didn’t smellof stale smoke (which a lotof hotel rooms do). Also, the room got very hot and we were taken aback to discover that, although there was an AC unit in the room, the hotel do not switch the system on until May. While we were in Manhattan the temperature was high 70s and into the 80s so this was quite a problem. After a few days, we asked for a plug-in fan which was supplied with no problem.Off the main room there was a very small kitchen equipped with sink unit, cupboards, fridge and gas cooker. The facilities were adequate, although there was a shortageof pots and pans and no microwave. Also, there was no toaster but, again, one was supplied once we asked. Opposite the kitchen, there was a small bathroom which included a bath with shower and shower curtain. There was always an ample supplyof hot water in the bathroom and kitchen. The room was cleaned once a day and the maid (Wendy) was friendly, hard-working and obliging. The suite was kept clean and the bed linen and towels were replaced each day. Free Wi-Fi was available in the lobby or, for payment in the room, if preferred......we just used the lobby. The accommodation is very conveniently located in termsof the supermarket (D’Agostino’s) just round the corner and to Grand Central Station (for subway) which is only a five minute walk. There is also a very good Japanese Restaurant opposite the supermarket (Hiroshi Sushi) and an inexpensive (but lovely food) Cuban Restaurant called Sophie’s at 369 Lexington Avenue, just a block or two away. There are also excellent shops in the adjacent Lexington and Park Avenues. During our stay, we found the staff friendly and helpful, especially the porters/door-men who were always keen to exchange a few words. Overall, in summary, although we have no big complaints about theMurray Hill East Suites, we felt that the costof the accommodation (around $200 per night) was a little expensive for what it is but, unfortunately, it was the best we could find at the time.

title: Old dated, nothing special
text:
The hotel is in a good location. The rooms are very old and dated. I won it via hotwire, so wasn't aware of it until I received a confirmation email. It is an ok hotel, the receptionists were hit and miss, 1 was polite, the other obnoxious. There is a kitchen in the rooms with a cooker and fridge. 
The rooms aren't tidy and we found a French fry, lolly pop and an old sock under the bed. Wouldn't recommend this place unless you get it last minute ....

title: Incredible value
text:
This venue is brilliantly situated, a walk from many of the major New York attractions and a couple of blocks from the Grand Central subway station. 

We occupied a suite, with my wife and I in the main bedroom and my daughter on a fold out bed in the lounge. This arrangement proved very satisfactory and comfortable for all three of us. The apartment was well furnished, with very comfortable beds, a useful kitchen and very adequate bathroom, with instant hot water in the morning.

The apartment was serviced every day and left immaculate. Another excellent feature was free internet available in the lobby (you could pay for internet in your room, but I can't see why you would do this).

Laundry facilities were available, but, with four very cheap laundries with in a block or so, it is hardly worth availing oneself of this facility. The Murray Hill also has a very adequate gym and workout facility.

The cost was extremely reasonable for a facility of this standard. I would heartily recommend Murray Hill East Suites to any visitor to New York.

title: Big suite with kitchen and lot of space. Close to Central station.
text: Big suite with kitchen and lot of space. Close to Central station. We had nice room on the ground floor - in this case wifi from lobby for free. But could be noisy in the morning. If you need add. bed for kids - very good choise.

title: Astral
text: Ótimo astral, ótima localização e preços.Recomendo

title: vicino al centro
text: Vicinissimo al centro, tant'è che dalla finestra è visibile l'Empire State building. camera grande e ben arredata,cucina e bagno moderno e funzionale. Le pulizie vengono effettuate tutti i giorni. Cambio della biancheria regolare e tranquillità e silenziosità dell'albergo. C'è la possibilità quini di cucinare in camera

title: If you want space over luxury, this is a good location
text: The location of this hotel, plus a kitchen, sold me.  My suite was spacious, with a full kitchen including stove, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, dishes, utensils, pots and pans and coffee maker.  There was a table and two chairs for eating, plus a sofa tucked in a corner.  The bathroom was well appointed and everything was in working order.  To my knowledge, there was no individual control over the room's temperature but it didn't present much of a problem as it was mostly a comfortable temperature.  The king sized bed and pillows were moderately comfortable. The internet service, which I ordered from my room, was dodgy and I didn't have time for a technician to come up to sort it out, so I never did get it.  The hotel is definitely older and could use a sprucing up, but it was clean.  I walked everywhere I went, the location was so convenient, so I saved money on transportation as well as eating breakfast and lunch in the suite.  I felt it was a bit pricey, however--for this money I could have stayed at the 4-star Carlton, or my usual favorite, the Affinia Shelburne, also in the area and more luxurious.  This might be a good choice for travel with children given the extra space and the ability to prepare meals.

title: lo mejor de nueva york!
text: excelente hotel! ubicacion ideal, limpio, prolijo, comodo y calefaccionado. fue ideal, la cocina muy buena, con todo lo indispensable, bano muy lindo. relacion calidad precio genial!!! atencion de primera. dormimos con mi marido en camas chicas separadas, pero nos dieron la suite junior, con terraza y mesa de comedor y sillon de tv con mesa auxiliar. no pudimos pedir mas

title: A great choice 15 minutes walk away from the UN building
text: Finding a good hotel at a decent rate in New York is often a challenge. The Murray Hill East Suites is exactly what we were looking for. Walking distance to the UN, comfortable spacious suite room with a small kitchen and a cosy living room and very friendly staff. Internet is free in the lobby but there is a charge to use it in the room. We had a few internet disruptions during our stay but not too long. We highly recommend this hotel.

title: good stay
text: Nice place to stay, just a bit old but very clean. Good location; supermarket around the corner (D’Agostino on 3rd Av 38 St), 3 blocks away from Grand Central Station, 4 to the Public Library. Chrysler Building also 3 blocks away, there is a Gap Store on the 3rd Av and 42 St; 3 blocks from the hotel. Friendly Staff.  Stayed last year, one bedroom + living room + full kitchen. They DO NOT turn the AC on till the 14th of May. Thought they give you an extra fan upon request.

title: gran ubicacon en new york
text:
hotel muy bien ubicado,muy comodo con salon con sofa cama ,dormitorio y cocina,super cerca dde muhos lugares para visitr
estuvimos muy contentos de haber estado alli. volveremos

title: THANKSGIVING N.Y
text: E' la seconda volta che usufruisco di questa struttura che si trova in un'ottima posizione per chi,come me,ama la downtown di N.Y.Io ho preso il bilocale con una camera da letto;letti comodi ampi mentre il sofa-bed nel soggiorno era di qualità scadente con molle rotte;pulizia buona ,cucina poco attrezzata di stoviglie (però hanno provveduto dopo la mia richiesta),mancanza collegamento internet in camera (solo nella hall peraltro sempre superaffollata !!!).Il personale alla reception è sgarbato e non ospitale ,spero a novembre prossimo di trovare persone più piacevoli e disponibili.Nonostante i lati negativi,tornerò anche perchè,secondo me il rapporto qualità prezzo è buono e poi il fatto che alla sera dopo una giornata frenetica puoi rilassarti come a casa, cucinarti una cosa e guardare la tv non ha prezzo!!

title: bien ubicado y muy comodo
text: Los departamentos son muy comodos. Estan muy bien ubicados y buen servicio. muy recomendable.

title: Pound for pound, I'd say good value vs our requirements/expectations
text:
Look, for this money on New Year's Eve a few blocks from Times Square, we felt this was fine. No, it's not a luxury residence, nor is it 'big on service'. It's functional and it's inexpensive, so for the purposes of acting as a 2-day base for shopping and dining out, it was absolutely ideal.

I booked on Hotwire (3* Times Square Area). The location & descriptions were typically slightly embellished, but genuinely I think it met, rather than exceeded or missed my expectations. Costs to me as follows, bearing in mind it was for 31st December and 01 January:

Rate per night: $234.00 / Nights: 2 / Rooms: 	1 / Taxes: $45.96 / Occupancy tax: $32.44 / Fees: $15.88 / Subtotal: 	$562.27 / Trip total: $562.27

I haven't posted photos because the ones published are all pretty accurate and if you remove the emotional descriptions (both good and bad), then the images pretty much speak for themselves. We didn't have peeling paint around the room, nor did we feel it was unclean inside. It was just very basic and outdated. As I say, for our purposes, that really didn't matter. Had we planned on staying in NYC for longer than 2 days, or intended using the room as anything more than somewhere to store our belongings and to sleep, then probably we'd have picked something more than a 3* anyway. Not everyone has the luxury of being able to do so (and yes, we know we're fortunate in that regard), so to try to remain objective about Murray Hill East I'd say it was absolutely fine. Not great, not terrible - 'fit for purpose', if your purpose is in line with ours.

For reference, we were given a street-facing room. Not ideal on NYE, especially because the only way to reduce the temperature was to open the window, but compared to the Waldorf Astoria 10 days later (reviewed separately if you're interested in that one), it was not something which bothered us unduly.

For any date other than NYE and NYD, I would be miffed at paying these prices for this level of accommodation, but we know NYC hotels well enough and neither the Hilton, Hyatt, W nor Waldorf would have merited the >$450/night + taxes they were demanding (for our purposes on this occasion), at this time of the year.

Hope that helps?

title: Roomy, reasonable, and clean
text: My partner and I spent a night at the Murray Hill East Suites and were thrilled with the size of the suite, especially considering the reasonable rate. Cleanliness is, of course, important and the hotel definitely passed the test. The staff and doorman were helpful, courteous, and friendly. We'll be staying there again in mid-February.

title: Algo Antiguo pero habitaciones enooormes!!
text:
Me alojé en este hotel en Diciembre de 2011. El hotel está bastante bien ubicado! Personalmente me gustan los hoteles céntricos que escapan de los meollos, y éste es justamente donde está! Tardábamos máximo 15 minutos a pie de Times Square y 5 a Bryan Park....Perfecto!! La estación de metro más cercana (Grand Central) está también a 5 minutos, pero el hotel se encuentra también muy cerca de paradas de Bus. Hay muchos comercios cercanos donde comprar comida o cualquier cosa que se necesite. 
Al llegar al hotel, nos dieron un Upgrade a una habitación con cama KING (enooooooooooooooooooooorme!) y un salón también muy muy grande desde el cual se veía el Empire Estate. El personal era amable pero sin emocionarse demasiado, correcto sin más. Es cierto que el hotel está un poco anticuado, pero las tarifas del Murray son muy correctas si comparas los precios con el resto de la ciudad. Repetiríamos sin ninguna duda!

title: Extra Tax Charged!!
text: We stayed in the murray hill suites over the thanksgiving period, Family of 4. We found the room very spacious,clean and comfartable. One thing i would just like to ask other guests is when we arrived we were asked to produce a credit card which would only be used as security for the room. When I got home and recived my credit card bill i had a 45 dollar charge added to my bill from the hotel. I then called the hotel and was told there is a 7.50 dollar per night tax on each room, the travel agent told me it was all inclusive but the hotel said otherwise. has anyone else experienced this? our experience otherwise was very good I just found this to be quite a bit under handed as we were never informed about these extra taxes. Janet Flanagan

title: Outdated from top to bottom
text:
Stayed here 1 night right before Christmas. Although its a large room, that's about the only great thing.
There's a kitchen, fridge, etc which I'm sure is handy, but we didn't really use. Large seating area, with old dingy furniture. Bed was awful, with a dip in middle. Bedding was just a sheet and blanket.
Bathroom was tiny. Heat had no thermostat. It was either hot or cold.
Overall there is potential but needs a major upgrade. Location is decent. Not in tourist area which is nice.

title: Personal de recepción poco amables y antipáticos.
text: El hotel está bastante bien , pero el personal de recpción es realmente antipático,ni hablar que encontrar a alguien que hable español es rarísimo.Muy poco serviciales.Los que si son muy amables ,son los porteros,quienes son muy atentos.La dirección del hotel debería evaluar seriamente el desinterés de algunas personas del staff.

title: Good value for the money
text:
We stayed in the Murray Hill East Suites for 4 nights in November 2011.  Overall we were very comfortable and enjoyed the excellent location despite the feeling upon entering the hotel that we had just stepped into the 1970's.

Pros: The rooms were large, the staff was helpful, though not more than that.  We stayed on the 8th floor facing away from the street and didn't have any problems with noise.  The bed was comfortable and we didn't see any bedbugs -- sometimes a problem in New York City.  The room had ample closet space, a small safe, a plasma TV (though only a few channels), a phone, and a small kitchen with a sink, oven and stovetop, and refrigerator.  An iron and ironing board were also provided.  We used the free wireless internet in the lobby which worked OK rather than paying for internet in the room (about $8/day).  The room had a table with a couple of chairs for meals and a small area with larger chairs in which we were able to receive guests.

The location is great!  About 7 minutes walk from Grand Central Station.  For those of you who don't know New York City, this means that it is easy to get to most attractions by subway.  The hotel within walking distance of the Empire State Building and of a string of Indian restaurants on Lexington avenue near 28th Street.  The kosher delicatessen 2nd Avenue Deli is only a few blocks away and very tasty.  Also, there are reasonably priced buses from Grand Central to La Guardia and JFK airports.

Cons: Except for the plasma TV, everything in the hotel seemed very old including the phone, the elevators and the decor.  Stylistic issues aside, this only presented us with minor problems twice:  At one point the elevators weren't working properly.  This only inconvenienced us for a few minutes.  Also, the lock on the safe (which is not big enough for a laptop computer) was mechanical rather than electronic.  We needed to go down to the front desk to request a lock and key to close the safe.  The hotel does not provide meals -- not even breakfast, though there are ample restaurants, supermarkets, and convenience stores withing close walking distance.

Two other problems -- as in many New York buildings, the room was too hot.  We had to leave the window open nearly all the time.  Also, the entrance is a few stairs down from street level with no ramp.  It was a bit hard managing our suitcases and I imagine anyone needing a wheelchair would find the hotel inconvenient.

We paid $130/night before taxes (about $25/night).  This included a $20 discount for being AAA members (American Automobile Association).  I called the hotel directly and got a slightly better rate than what I saw offered on line.

Overall, this was certainly not a luxury hotel, but we were quite comfortable and would stay there again if we return to NYC.

title: un lindo hotel cerca de todo
text: lo bueno que tiene este hotel es que son departamentos muy lindos que en el caso de ser una familia podes alojar los chicos en el comedor, tiene lavavajillas, heladera microondas esta muy bueno para pasar tus dias en NY.

title: Think Twice
text: Location is ideal and the rooms are large but very outdated.  The hallway and street noise is very loud due to the fact that the room doors automatically slam and the windows are old.  Also, the place has a faint cigarette smoke smell to it.   If you can spend a little more for a nicer hotel do it, if not, this place is ok.

title: EXCELENTE UBICACION
text: buen hotel con una excelente ubicacion  a un paso de los mejores lugares de NY , la calidad de la atencion no es de las mejores pues hay algunas empleadas , principalmente una señorita de la conserjeria, que no lo entienden y manifiesta no hablar español  y no se preocupa por entenderte.-

title: Great Friends Weekend
text: I was with 6 other friends and we had the 2 bedroom suite. We booked 2 one bedroom units but they offered us the 2 bedroom when we arrived and it suited our needs much better in fact, it was perfect for our needs. The unit was large, bright and quite quiet. We could even open windows for fresh air. We loved being able to sit around the huge living room and relax between outings and before bed. The unit was super clean and comfortable. Furniture and colours are older but nothing was shabby or uncomfortable. Full kitchen made for easy light breakfasts. The location was fabulous - close to subway and walking to main areas easy. A great stay all around.

title: Great Location
text: The room's are gigantic by Manhattan standards. The beds could have been better.Furniture was a little old.Front office staff were very polite and helpful.  Great housekeeping, kept rooms clean and tidy. Free Wifi in lobby.At these prices you get what you pay for. Good location. But please be reminded that New York City/Manhattan is not a quite place. You are right next to the midtown tunnel exit and there are numerous construction sites nearby that operate 24 hours. It can be very noisy. But then who comes to Manhattan to sleep. Good value for money.

title: Good choice for home comforts in central Manhattan
text:
I've stayed here many times and alwasy had a good experience. Admittedly the rooms are a bit dated but they are very big and usually at a very reasonable price. The smallest room which i beleive is the junior suite is still a large room with sitting room area, kitchen and 3 wardrobes. I'm not sure why there are so many wardrobes but there you go!

The staff are fairly competent but there is never much need to interact with them. Internet is either $7 a day or $50 a month which is expensive in my opinion as i only ever stay there for a week so have to pay $50.

However the fact i keep copming back means that i would recommend this place.

title: Good location, nice lobby, room okay
text: I liked being here, because the rooms are definitely larger than the typical New York hotel, and does have a 'long stay' feel to it-- what with the little kitchen, etc. Nice large windows-- they don't look out at anything great, but it's nice to have big windows.  Yes, true, it is dated. Not in such a terrible way-- its just not chic and cool by any means at all.  We had asked for long-term rates and were told unreasonably high prices, so I'm surprised by the other reviewer who stated that they were able to negotiate lower rates for longer stays. I would like to know why the disparity in responses from the staff on this. I would certainly be interested in staying here for a longer stay, but what's the deal with reduced cost request getting a Yes or a No? If management reads this, please respond. Thanks.

title: Muy cómodo!
text:
Fui en mayo con toda  mi familia, somo 6, incluido un  bebe, y nos atendieron muy bien.
La zona esta muy bien, viajamos  muchas veces a NYC y paramos en varios lugares, realmente este es una muy buena opción para mas de 3 personas. Sobre todo teniendo en cuenta precio-calidad.
Esta cerca de todo, pero en una calle muy tranquila.
En la esquina hay un supermercado y en la otra un deli, ideal para compra y cocinar.
A 3 cuadras esta la estación central en donde se encuentran todas las  lineas de subway.
Realmente fue muy cómodo parar en el hotel.
[--]

title: Great location-Suites are large though dated
text:
My husband and I stayed at Murray Hill East Suites in late August 2011. We were looking for a hotel close to Grand Central so that  we could have easy access to the U.S. Open.

We got a good deal through Hotwire's Hot Rate program. The hotel is about a 2 block easy walk from Grand Central Station and is on a reasonably quiet, leafy side street. There is a small neighborhood grocer nearby as well as numerous restaurants literally one minute away.

The hotel itself is someone dated. As other reviewers have stated, the rooms look like they have not been renovated since the 1980's. Aesthetics aside, the rooms are quite large for Manhattan standards and even have a kitchenette, dining table, and living room. If you are just looking for a wonderfully located hotel in Manhattan without any of the bells or whistles, I recommend this hotel.

title: Reasonable but unkept and old
text:
This apartment hotel meets minimum standards for cleanliness and habitability, but it is not a four star hotel. The interior is old, the rooms/apartments even older. 

The staff is pleasant but not well-trained and often don't know what to do about basic problems  ...like replacing missing utensils in apartment kitchens.

It is not a bad place for extended stays if you can negotiate a good rate. Rack rates (even with usual NYC 30% discount) are ripe-offs. Ask for at least 50% discount more for long stays. We negotiated about 65% discount on rack rates for 10 day stay.

title: Great New York Experience
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights with our teenage children.  It is in an excellent location and is a very comfortable apartment with all the facilities needed for our stay including  kitchen, laundry, gym .
It is walking distance to many of the top tourist spots, Times Square, Rockefeller centre, Grand Central Station, Broadway, UN Headquarters, so easy to come back, have a rest then start over again!

title: Unless you like old smelly hotels, DO NOT STAY HERE!
text: Seriously, who is rating this place?  Bought it on Hotwire and I have serious buyers remorse. Especially at the $250/night rate that I'm paying. Here's what you can really expect. OLD. Furniture is beat up. Carpets are stained and dirty. Towels are paper thin and thread bare. Room smells like smoke.

title: unfriendly staff
text: the friendly staff mentioned in other reviews must have been on vacation when we stayed there.  we found the staff to be very unfriendly and unhelpful.  the kitchen was far from satisfactory.  it was clean but very basic. best thing going for it was that it is in an excellent location.

title: Location, Size and Comfort
text:
Myself and my girlfriend travelled to NYC for the first time this September and on recommendation from friends and other reviews booked the Murray Hill East Suites. We were very delighted with the cleanliness, space and facilities all for a great price.

Firstly the negatives: the decor is quite dated, just dated looking and nothing was shoddy or damaged. Thats about it.

The location is very very central, only a few blocks from Times Square and not far at all from Grand Central (many Subways from here) but we walked almost everywhere around mid town from the apartment. The immediate area is quite quiet, which was nice, good to get away from the madness for a few minutes. But get in after a long days sight seeing, good shower, quick nibble of food from your own kitchen and back out into a cab / walk for an evening of dining and entertainment. The area being quiet actually encouraged us to travel to different areas.

Staff were very polite and attentive, rooms were immaculate and cleaned every day. Small but functional kitchenette, TV with plenty of channels. Huge bed. A very hot strong shower (one of my big necessities for any accom I stay in). 

The rooms were absolutely huge, massive amounts of space. I would recommend this place to anyone.

title: Great value, location
text: Our family of 4 found the suites to be very comfortable, spacious and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great - parking garage around the corner, short walk to Grand Central, Bryant Park, subway. We had a view of the Empire State Building from our room. It was like having an apartment in the city.Decor is dated, but rooms are clean and spacious.

title: Nice Suites
text: I found the 'Murray Hill East Suites' to be clean and in a perfect area to get around Manhattan, NYC.  The hotel is close to Grand Central Station and NYC Subway's.  The front desk employees were very friendly and helpful.

title: Excelente ubicación y servicio
text:
Excelente hotel para viajar en familia. Departamentos espaciosos con cocina totalmente equipada. A pocas cuadras a pie de todos los lugares que quieras visitar. Barrio muy tranquilo.
Sin duda volvería a este hotel en una nueva visita a la ciudad.

title: Great place for a relaxing stay in the busy city.
text:
We had a corner room and lots of windows which was great. It had a full kitchen, a bedroom with 2 queen beds plus a separate living room with sofa bed and dining table. Very spacious for 3 adults. The front desk employees were very efficient and helpful. 

This was definitely my most relaxing NYC trip because it was like having a home to go to after tramping all over the city.

title: good location, good value,good view
text: It is about 8 minutes walk from the grand central station, very convenient. and there are lots of restaurants and convenient stores nearby.  The room is comfortable , gived me a sense of living in my home. The view from my room is also nice.

title: Great location, huge room (due to free upgrade)
text:
Booked via discount site, ended up getting a free upgrade from a 1-bedroom to a 2-bedroom suite so we had 2 bedrooms (each with 2 double beds), 2 bathrooms, full living/dining/kitchen etc.

Kitchen fully stocked with dishes, pots & pans, silverware etc.

Basically nothing bad I can say about Murray Hill East Suites, friendly staff, great location, got a good price, free upgrade to a better room. Parking is around the corner and their discount rate is actually pretty reasonable for Manhattan (I think it was $25/24 hours).

Would definitely book again.

title: Good value for money.
text: I stayed in a studio room with a kitchenette, large living area. Staff were friendly and helpful. Close to 5th Ave. Times Square, etc.

title: This is a great place to stay in NY. Never disappointed.
text:
We have stayed here 6/7 times in the past and we have never been disappointed. The rooms are an amazing size for NY and very reasonably priced for the location. Easy walking distance to Grand Central Station, 42nd Street and even Times Square. The Empire State Building is also within reasonalble walking distance.

Check in is always quick and efficient. Staff are pleasant and polite.The rooms have been updated since our last visit and have new carpets and decor. Beds are large and comfortable and kitchen facilities are helpful. A home away from home! - There is good local eating and we love the 'local' feel of the area as opposed to other  more tourist focused parts of the city. This hotel is well looked after and spotlessly clean. It has good wifi connection and flat screen TVs.

This is our preferred accommodation when we are in the city. We have stayed elsewhere, but nowhere else is as good and we will always stay here is there are rooms available. We have also recommended the Murray Hill East Suites to a number of friends who agree with us that this is the place to stay in NY city.

Tip - As it was very hot in the city during our visit, we did not fancy using the subway, so we took the M103 bus which runs downtown on Lexington through to City Hall.

title: This is not an amazing hotel
text:
Ok, there are some great things about this hotel.  The biggest one being location.

The hotel is a five minute walk to Grand Central Station.  For first time visitors - it's a great place to get shuttles to any airport and it's a central hub for NYC's subway.  It's a fifteen minute walk to 5th avenue, Time's Square and The Empire State Building.  As mentioned before there is a kitchen in the rooms and you can buy food at Grand Central's market and cook it - which we did - and at the convenience store by the hotel.

The other good thing about the hotel is the cleanliness - the staff are attentive and do an excellent and fast job of cleaning the rooms.  

The last good thing is the price.  Most Manhattan hotels are far more expensive than where we stayed.  It was good to have a "suite" in Manhattan for less than $200 per night.  The fact that a kitchen is in the room can be a major price saver as you can make your own meals instead of going to Manhattan's expensive restaurants.  

The worst is to come.  For a three star hotel everything in the room is dated.  The carpet, floor and wall tile, fixtures, kitchen equipment, washroom and everything else is very dated.  It's like a trip back in time.  It wouldn't be bad but it feels unclean in the back of your mind.  Also many other 3 stars I've been in had better more modern fixtures in the kitchens and bathrooms.  This was not the case in our room.

Also and I don't know if this is the case in most NYC hotels but here goes.  Again for a three star I expect a few more amenities.  This hotel had no pool, no washing machines, no vending / ice machines - they expect you to fill an ice tray in your own room's tiny fridge, no pay per view movie channels - NYC is fun but sometimes it's good to kick up your feet and watch a movie and relax, the best WIFI is in the hotel's lobby where I often saw many people on their laptops and no restaurant.  There's a flat screen tv in the room with numerous channels and a fitness room.  So most of the comforts of hotels are not at this hotel.  

The bathroom was the worst part for me.  The kitchen is bigger than the bathroom!  Forget about two people using the sink at the same time - if you can get two people to fit in that bathroom at the same time.  And watch your feet as you walk in.  For some strange reason the floor tile in the bathroom is higher than the carpet just at the outside of the bathroom.  

I would stay again for the location but if I could find something else at a similar price and similar location but had some more hotel comforts - then I would choose there.  That would include paying a little extra.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Very Clean
text:
stayed at this hotel for a weekend in July 2011. The hotel staff were very friendly and the check in was quick and easy.

The hotel offers offsite parking which was very well priced considering you are in Manhattan. The parking lot is 1.5 blocks away from the hotel and less than 3 minute walk.

The room that I got was like a bachelor apartment, with a separate dining area. It offered a small kitchen. There was an LCD TV in the room with lots of channels (not like your going to watch TV while in NYC)

The hotel was very clean and located in a great location.  

I would certainly return back to this hotel and recommend this to my friends as well.

title: Justo el hotel que esperábamos!
text: El hotel es muy bueno contemplando la categoría ofrecida. Las grandes ventajas son su ubicación cerca del Empire State y Times Square. Grandes y cómodos ambientes. Probablemente sea necesario mejorar los utensillos de cocina aumentando su cantidad, ya que apenas nos arreglábamos para 4 personas.

title: Esta super bien ! buen tamaño del departamento,impecable !
text:
Viajamos 4 de familia.el depto super comodo,muy limpio,muy bien ubicado!
Tiene todo,cocina,heladera,tostador etc,esta muy bien !

title: Amazing location, I definately recommend it!
text: We went to New York in June and we wanted a hotel with a good location, but not too expensive. This hotel was perfect! It was just a few steps away from Grand Central, Empire State Building and Times Square. The rooms were okay, with big flat-screen televisions and comfortable beds. For me, the hotel isn´t that important, I just need somewhere to stay, and I don´t spend much time at the hotel, and if you have the same thoughts about travelling that I have, this is probably perfect for you. We didn´t eat breakfast at the hotel (it´s much cheaper to buy at the grocery-store or eat at a cafe). We also had a small kitchen, and that was perfect for us. The lobby was cosy, even though we, as I said didn´t spend much time there. the staff were very friendly, and helpt us with our luggage when we left. If you go to New York and want I hotel thats clean, comfortable and near almost all the top-sights in the city, stay here. I definately recommend it!

title: Back to the 80s!
text: This is a small hotel on the East Side that has decor straight out of a 1980s era bad TV movie. However, it's clean and if you get a low rate you will likely enjoy the flashback!

title: Great stay
text: These suites are very well located in Murray Hill neighborhood. We had the best room in the hotel, the only one with a terrace. Very comfortable. Service was good overall.

title: BUONO MA NON ECCEZIONALE
text:
Hotel buono, posizione stupenda nel centro di New York vicino all'Empire.
Camere accoglienti e pulitissime, personale della Hall antipatico e sgarbato al contrario di quello delle camere.
Nelle camere non esiste Internet il solo punto dove si puo' utilizzare e nella Hall dell'hotel. Nella Hall si prende internet solamente in 2 punti. Uno vicino alla porta di entrata e l'altro vicino alla vetrata. Ad ogni ora c'è la coda di persone che aspetta che qualche d'uno liberi i posti privileggiati per connettersi. Perciò impossibile connettersi a meno di andarci dalle 2 alle 4 del mattino.
Grossissima pecca di questo albergo. Al giorno d'oggi non avere Internet neanche a pagamento nelle camere.
Sopratutto a New York  che ristoranti discoteche ti chiedono una mail per prenotare. 
A New York ci tornerò ma non in questo Hotel. 
Hotel confortevole per famiglie e persone che non utilizzano internet.
Prezzo nella norma.

title: Good value for midtown location. Sweet suites
text:
Murray Hill East Suites is a great base for business or tourists. The suites are large with separate kitchens and decent furnishings. I have stayed many times and find the staff friendly and helpful. I have had rooms with lingering cigarette orders and some of the smaller rooms are sort of depressing. However if you get an upper floor suite the rooms are a very good value. They have weekly discounts. The nicest rooms are the one bedroom suites which are well worth it if you have a group of folks - The bedroom has two beds and the living room has a comfy foldout sofa. I would recommend this hotel for an extended stay with people coming and going.

The maid service is OK. In a lot of ways they leave you alone in the larger suites. They do come and do the dishes, empty the trash and clean the bathrooms on a daily basis. If you need something (like extra pillows for company) they are pretty good but it is better to ask during the day as the night shift is sparse.

title: A nice surprise
text: We were a party of five: me, my wife, two kids and my mother-in-law. We were looking for two double bedrooms and had an excellent full two-bedroom apartment on 12th floor. By "full" I mean FULL: two large bedrooms with two queen beds each, two renovated bathrooms, one LARGE living room with dining room, a full kitchen and, the cherry on the top, a real solarium. The apartment was clean, the furniture is old style 60's in excellent shape. The location is also very good with many restaurants and transportation around. It does not have the services or the "luxe" of a 4/5 star hotel but I definitely recommend it.

title: Rapporto qualità prezzo ottimo
text:
Ho soggiornato da poco in questo hotel con mia moglie e le nostre 2 bimbe, di 11 anni la prima e di 1 e mezzo la piccola, trovandomi molto bene.
 le camere sono spaziose e pulite e avendo la cucina sono perfette per chi come me viaggiava con bambini.
Il prezzo della stanza è ragionevole,  il personale disponibile e l'ubicazione è perfetta, perché sì trova a pochi passi dalla 5th avenue,dalla gran central station e dall' empire state building, inoltre in 15 minuti a piedi si arriva a Times square.
Sono vicine anche alcune fermate della metro che per chi viaggia con passeggini non è il massimo essendo quasi tutte le stazioni prive di scala mobile o ascensori.
Enjoy your trip in NY

title: Home Away from Home
text: For about six months, I had to travel from Northern CT to NYC for business, spending 3-5 days per week in the city. I bounced from hotel to hotel, seeking cheap rates and decent accommodations. Once I stayed at the Murray Hill East, I stopped bouncing around and stayed there for the balance of my visits. It was like having my own apartment in NYC, because that's what the suites are - converted apartments. I always booked the Junior Suites, but was frequently upgraded to one of the Premium Suites, and on one occasion had a three bedroom suite (really a large apartment!) all to myself! Understand, it is not a fancy place - the decor is dated, but everything is in fine condition and the appliances (iron, fridge, stove, etc.) all work perfectly well. I give a slightly lower rating for cleanliness only because of one room I stayed in that desperately needed the carpet changed, but that was truly an exception. Also, like others have said, not tons of amenities IN the hotel, but nearby EVERYTHING you could possibly need, including Grand Central. Anytime I go back to NYC, I will definitely book a room here.

title: muy buena opcion
text:
estuve en este hotel a mediados de abril de 2011
es excelente la ubicacion, rodeado de sitios para comer o supermercados
las habitacion son amplias, cocina completisima y muy buena atencion de parte de las 
mucamas
cambio de toallas diarios, cafe de cortesia y amenities todos los dias
lo malo, es que el servicio de wi fi es caro y no muy bueno y el acceso al hotel no cuenta con rampa para cochecitos de bebes o silas de ruedas

title: Excelente
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado. A pocos pasos de Grand Central, Times square, Naciones Unidas, entre otros. Atención de primera. Muy buena opción si vas con familia.  Volvería sin dudarlo

title: good average hotel but can find slightly nicer in same price range
text:
Stayed 3 nights because we needing to be close to the UN. We booked the studio room but on check-in found they had given our room away and tried to put us in a disgusting SMOKING room. We made it clear what kind of room we booked and made it perfectly clear what time we were checking-in (late) - and we arrived EXACTLY on time. We immediately requested they find us another room, and although they insisted they had no other available room, mysteriously moved us to another room that didn't smell (what happened to being fully booked and NO other rooms available??) The next day we were moved to a 3rd room that had 1 king bed instead of two smaller beds. We consider giving our reserved room to someone else and this deception about being fully booked to be totally unacceptable. This is not professional.

I don't know what were the type of rooms we were moved to, but the first two were much larger than the final room where we stayed - the final room had the larger bed. With hindsight I wish we had kept the 2nd room as it had separate living room and bedroom, and was more comfortable (although there were 2 small beds instead of one large). The kitchenette in most (or all) rooms is a great feature, and even the smaller rooms are big-ish sized for NYC. However, the bathroom in the last room was small and VERY tight.

Reception staff are typical New Yorkers - curt and unfriendly - compared to say Australia or England. The FREE internet in the lobby was most welcome, and the in-room internet rates were reasonable. We stayed on the back side which was MUCH quieter, and we occasionally were able to connect to a nearby open wireless network, saving us a trip to the lobby for the free internet.

I guess overall it was not bad and not great - just average. Our biggest gripes would be (1) the disgusting smokers room, (2) the tiny cramped bathroom, and (3) the less than friendly reception staff.

title: Mitigé
text: Bien situé, chambre-appartement, très spacieux, propre, mais les chambres mériteraient un rafraîchissement général (vieillottes), Wi-Fi payant. Très bizarrement ils chargent les cartes de crédit de dépenses non effectuées (et non reprises sur la facture). Ma collègue et moi-même en avons été victimes. Cela nécessite des démarches au retour pour essayer de récupérer ces "faux frais". Cela n'est pas très commercial!

title: EXCELLENT! I would recommend to everybody and dont believe other non complmentry reviews
text:
Well, we read all the reviews on this hotel, and quite frankly I think those who were non complimentry must have been somewhere else. We cannot find fault at all, the suite was extremly spacious, beds brilliant etc - we were on the 14th floor. The only thing I would say is if you dont smoke make sure you ask for a non smoking room ours did have a faint wiff of cigarette smoke.

The hotel is well situated for all the main attractions of New York. Times Square 15mins walk, Central park 30mins walk, Grand central station 10min walk.

If you have not arranged transport to your accomodation, dont worry, I would recommend you get on one of the airport shuttles. We landed at Newark and it was $17 each to Manhatten, you can get a return for around $27 each. It does take longer as there are other passengers ( the shuttle takes about 12 passengers). But its alot cheaper than a taxi. You also get to see a lot of New york depending upon where they are dropping off. Taxis - we were told - charge extra for lugage and tolls.

Be prepared for the cost of eating out. It is not cheap experience,it is just as expensive to buy and cook yourself. However, I can recommend the following:

Siniqual, 640 Third avenue (on the corner of41st and 3rd avenue) - its just around the corner from the hotel and decribes itself as comtemporary mexican  cusine
.
Sea, 114 north 6 st Brooklyn, a thai resturant reasonably priced. the one we visited was where a scene from 'sex and the City' was filmed. There is more than one in New York.

Hale and Hearty, all over New York. They are a great place to go for a lunch time bite. Thye mainly have soup - homemade(?)- try the chicken balsamic and avocado ciabiato

Andrews Coffe shop 35th st and 7th Avenue - great for breakfast and great coffee, a continual flow

Chipotle, again all over York- A mexican take away. A place to go for lunch or if you want to eat on the move at night and want something quick and filling.

title: Great value in a Big Apple suite
text: Not the newest hotel, and not many amenities, but it has what's important. It has a great location (5 minute walk to Grand Central and a major subway hub), a safe neighborhood with plenty of useful shops, parking within one block, and rooms that are a steal. Our two-person studio suite had three closets, a comfortable bedroom, a living room, a mini-dining area and a fully equipped kitchenette. We saved money on the price of the room, we saved money on the breakfast that we enjoyed in our breakfast nook, we saved money not paying for things we didn't need, and we left feeling relaxed (which doesn't always happen on a New York vacation). Great deal for a couple, but with the kitchenette it's probably an even bigger deal for a family. We will be back.

title: Kanon Hotel
text: Vi är väldigt nöjda med hotellet. Det var en komplett lägenhet. Vi var 4 st varav två tonårsbarn, 16, 18 år. Ett sovrum hade två dubbelsängar och i vardagsrummet fanns en stor bäddsoffa. Komplett kök. En stor takterass fanns, helt otroligt. Utsikt mot ESB. Det var kanske inte det mest moderna stället men rent. Hissen var långsam men man kom upp och ned. Mataffär och massa take away-ställen i närheten. Det kostade ca 17.000 för 8 dagar. Tycker att det var prisvärt. Det var gratis internet nere i lobbyn.

title: Great place, felt like being home
text:
As I was for business in New York for 4 weeks (8 January to 5 February 2011) and didn’t want to spend all this time in a small overpriced hotel room, I decided to book the Murray Hill Suites. As I didn’t know it and wasn’t sure if I would like it, I initially booked for a week with the possibility to extend. After a few days it was clear to me, and booked for the full 4 weeks. The location is great and I had no problems with the staff at all. They were always very helpful and housekeeping kept my (big) studio impeccable. I agree that this accommodation can not be compared with a big five star fancy new hotel, and the furniture is from the eighties, but the price is very reasonable and I find the suites extremely comfortable. I will for sure recommend this accommodation to all my friends and colleagues who are looking for a clean and affordable place in NYC.
I can only repeat, RAY and STAFF thank you very much for making me feeling so welcome.

title: Excelente apartamento
text: Muy bien ubicado, seguro. Fui con mi esposo y mis hijos a pasar Navidad y Año Nuevo, de verdad que todo excelente!!!

title: Filthy Room, Awful Service, Careless Staff
text:
Is a clean bed too much to ask for?  Apparently so. I checked in and had dirty sheets - long black hairs all over the sheets.  I thought, okay, its not a big deal.. this can be taken care of in the morning with the daily bed linen service.  I stopped down at the front desk and requested clean sheets which is a daily service standard.  After my room was serviced I checked the bed, still finding black hairs all over the sheets.  I marched down to the front desk a 2nd time, politely requesting clean sheets.  The housekeeping staff had the nerve to remake the bed and carelessly brush off the hair (hint: you missed a few spots).  I finally was forced to stop down at the desk, request clean sheets, and make my own bed!! 

The front desk staff either was (A) Not surprised by the poor service; or, (B) Did not care.  

Spend the extra $30-$40 night for a livable, not "lived in", hotel room.

title: Worst hotel experience in New York
text:
I arrived at 10 PM, and asked for my reservation i had made for a room for 2 people. I was provided with a room with a single twin-sized bed.  I looked at the room, which was indeed large by New York standards, but dingy and smelled rank (even though they said it  was a non-smoking room. hm.) The furniture seemed it had not been updated in decades. It was by far the worst I have seen in any of the numerous hotels in NYC that I have stayed in.  

The worst part that earned this one-star-cause-i-cant-go-lower review was  the customer care. The front desk was condescending, would not look at me when I spoke to them. when I finally  complained that I booked a room for two and I could barely fit a single adult in the bed they provide. They gave an off-handed response that "this is s the only room we have". 

I had to book a room with a competitor for same price for tremendously better experience a block over. I paid twice since they would not refund me. 

The location is not superior to the hundreds of hotels in the area and i do not understand how they set a 3-star hotel expectation and continue to stay in business. not repeat business, I am sure.

title: Hôtel très bien placé
text: Chambres spacieuses, mobilier un peu vétuste. Le service était correct;;. Une déception, les matelas des canapés-lits sont inconfortables. Et la connexion internet est payante (7 dollars par jour tout de même)

title: A great value in NYC
text: My wife and I enjoyed a one night stay at this location during the Christmas season.  It is conveniently located, as it is just off the beaten path of all the major mid-town attractions that you want to expose yourself to during the Holiday.  This location is great as far as I'm concerned because it gives you the luxury of being away from all the chaos and crowds when your done exploring the attractions.  Hotel staff was wonderful, check in convenient, and accomodations very clean with lots of space in the suite.

title: amazing location and value
text: Our rooms were humongous for NYC and very clean with full kitchen/refrigerator/dishwasher. outdated decor but who cares? you can see the top empire state bldg from the sidewalk outside (and russia! ha ha.) service was amazing with housecleaning every day. The local subway stop was Grand Central (5 mins) so lots of transport options. Our room was actually too warm so we turned the heat off most of the time. though we only went there to sleep, it was a great bonus to come back to a huge suite.

title: Great Value
text: A great location- very handy to everything in New York-only about a 10 minute walk to Time Square. Also A quick walk to Grand Central Station which made things even easier. Our room was in original condition but very clean and tidy, and also extremely spacious. It was more like a loft or studio than a hotel serviced hotel room.

title: no heating with 30°F outside
text:
a little dusty and not the cleanest carpet, but for the price it would have been ok, not a great deal, but oookaaaay...
But not to have a functioning central heating and the end of November for 2 weeks and to give us a little electric heating for two pretty big rooms is hilarious!!!
Thats a NO-GO!!!
Never again.

title: Double charge
text:
Old style apartment hotel - spacious and great location. 

I've settled all my bills by cash when checked out, and they charge those again to my credit card. I called them to discuss about it and they told me to send an email. I sent the email and never received a response or a reimbursement.

Lucky my bills are small, so it's not worth the fight and long distance call.

title: Huge suite/Great value
text:
It's a former apartment hotel, and my wife and I had a bedroom, living room, and kitchen. TV is old as are building and furnishings, but it is clean and neat. Staff is very helpful, and location is convenient to entire Midtown East, UN, and Grand Central. Plenty of enjoyable restaurants nearby, especially Cibo around the corner. 
No luxury, but a great value and wonderful space.

title: Surprise
text:
Not wanting to stay at one of the over priced hotels in midtown Manhattan, we stayed at the Murray Hill East Suites based on recommendations from friends. 

The building is located two blocks from the drop off point for the Newark Express bus at the back of Grand Central Station. We were surpised when arriving that it does resemble a hotel with a 24 hour reception and concierge service. The accommodation was busy with travelers from a few different countries. It was the week of the New York marathon which might have been a factor but we got the impression that this was normal.

It is clear that this had previously been an apartment block and the accommodation comprised of a large lounge area with bed settee, bedroom with two queen sized beds, kitchen and bathroom. There was a problem with the heating in the room when we first arrived. We were told it  was in fact a problem in the whole building and could not be fixed till the following day. The reception provided a heater within a few minutes which we were able to keep for the duration of our stay.

The accommdation is clean and comfortable without being luxurious. It is a bit dated but this is something that we've found in New York in general on previous visits.

The building has a couple of good quality diners within a minutes walk (try Scotties for good value). There are some local bars in the area which are ok for a quick visit. 

If you choose not to walk too far, Manhattan is best navigated by the Subway system. Grand Central is the nearest subway station (about a 5/10 minute walk) with Times Square a further 10 minute walk. This isn't a huge problem but it can be a bit tiring after a day sightseeing or shopping.

At $235.00 a night (plus tax) it is in the same price range as some hotels but you do certainly get more for your money than just a simple room.

I would certainly recommend the Murray Hill Suites especially to families or groups of people.

title: muy bien situado, muy espacioso ,pero mobiliario muy antiguo
text:
El sitio en que esta hubicado es muy bueno, hay supermercado y lugares donde comer cerca,es muy tranquilo , pero muy seguro.
Estivimos una semana mi hermana, mi esposo y yo y lo pasamos muy bien porque nos sentiamos como en casa.
Solo consideramos los tres , que el mobiliario es muy antiguo y desgastado,la television de los años 70 y las camas un poco pequeñas y los colchones regulares.

title: fabulous hotel great location
